tkqK-hb5lGP5DCpug-1smQ.text: Really cool vibe and I like the environment. It's hard to find seating, which is hard if you are planning to eat. A little hard to find, but my first experience there was a really good one. I'll be back!

afQSMQDdTLELcxcLa8dMWA.text: I liked it here so much that we went back twice in one week!  It is a great place to take a big group, kids and out of town friends/family.  They do not take reservations and it is seat yourself. There is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating at long wooden tables.  It gets very crowded on the weekends and for happy hour so be prepared to hunt for a table and wait in long food/drink lines.  On a late Thursday evening we had no trouble finding a spot and went right to the bar to order our drinks. They have a lot of great cocktails and local beers on tap. I went with my favorite, Full Pint T-Funk.  You then have 4 restaurant options to choose from each with their own ordering counter.  From sandwiches to tacos and Michigan style pizza Federal Galley has something for everyone. I was with two friends that are vegan and they were pleasantly surprised with all of the food options they had.  I ordered chips and guacamole plus a taco at the taco place. The tacos are very small so you definitely need more than just one.  The chips were the perfect amount of salty and not too greasy with very fresh guacamole.  On my next visit I went with the kielbasa sandwich from Super which comes with your choice of duck fat fries, chickpea fries or a salad. I am so glad I went with the salad as it had tons of toppings including tomatoes and quinoa plus a light vinaigrette dressing.  We will definitely be back!

CGRwCeBS04ddQ5yi5UK4zg.text: Went here for brunch this morning and really am a huge fan of the concept.  There is a large seating area around a central bar with four different restaurant options to choose from (my appreciation of how the menus were organized) - classic american, mexican fusion, pizza, and upscale brunch.  You could choose to get small plates from each or stick to one.  I ended up with the buffalo style cauliflower from the classic american and eggs benedict from the upscale brunch, both delicious options.  My only comment about the eggs benedict is they substituted the bread for eggplant, however, I would have opted for a consistency more closely aligned with the starch option.  This aside, the place is great for large groups of people as you individually order your food and pay at the counter.  Great young and fun vibe, highly recommend!

4syqReb7fRdHAa04oufA9w.text: I love coming here, but lately there has been a bar tender that has ruined my experience not once, but twice now.  He usually wears a ball cap backwards with a pirates t-shirt.  Every time I order from the bar it feels like he's doing me a service taking my order.  He responds with venom if you ask him a question and it really seems like he just does not enjoy what he's doing.  I have had nothing but great experiences with every other server, but for him it really seems as if he is out to cause everyone to have a terrible experience.  If visiting federal galley avoid him at all costs and I promise you will have nothing but a great experience.

uM_c8ibw4QieTjvMPjHSHA.text: Pretty neat place, good for lunch, dinner and happy hour. Very diverse options to meet many palates. Outdoor seating is awesome, weather permitting.

ndjOSZPieClJ8N5fsOTAog.text: I am a huge fan of Smallman Galley and I love the concept.  At both of the he galleys in Pgh it has been done super well!!   Federal Galley is new.  There are 4 great concepts in one spot. It's like an incubator for great new talent. Basically you look at each chefs menu and order what you want. When you pay for it you get a number that you take to the table that you chose and they bring the food to you. Super simple and delicious!!! The space is verrrrry clean. It's a beautiful space that used to be a bank. The bar is set up where the old safe was - it's pretty cool.  The ceilings are high, creating a very open and urban feel. It's a bright space with tons of light.  The bar is amazing!  I love the featured drinks. They change periodically. And they have a great beer selection. I've been here for lunch only so far. I got a burge from provision. It was amazing!!!  My lunch mate had the pizza. It looked so good.  The menus are diverse and if it's like Smallman- sometimes they evolve over time based on feedback.  I'm planning to go again today. It will be hard to pass up the pizza but really there's so many choices....  I will say the I love the space but the way the tables are set up and how sparse the space is makes it feel just a bit like a cafeteria. I'll be interested to see how this changes over time.

zKLaBjJnsy0QYOLWnsMPog.text: Great venue and food!  Works really well for a wide selection for varied appetites.  A late Saturday evening supper offered a high energy friendly vibe with good outdoor seating. Provision provided a tasty burger and Sammy burger one with fries and one with a good side salad and housemade 1000 island.  The staff was friendly, delivered food to our tables and watched to provide fresh filled water bottles.  Followed up with brunch on Sunday with a lively World Cup energy and Supper was the star of the day along with the cheerful bar crew.  Definitely looking forward to our next visit.

1o8WvJhMndXyMx7T_J5ZtQ.text: I have been a huge fan of Smallman galley and now federal galley. I have referred tons of ppl to these two places, including large groups. I contacted the event planner to reserve the private space to host approximately 30-35 ppl and without any explanation, she informed me that both the restaurants won't allow you to rent the private room on a Friday or Saturday night, which to me is odd considering most ppl hold events on Friday or Sat evenings. Business must be really good that they don't even want to work with 30+ ppl who will be eating and drinking at the establishment. Interesting.

q3UuPi7fSnQWJjBcVdrn9A.text: Interesting setting with plenty of room to move around. Gotta say, when we walked into the gallery, I right away "adjusted" my expectation because the setting reminded me of food court in a mall, and we all know how good the quality mall food is... but when I took a bite of my fried chicken sandwich from Provision, I was reminded you should never judge a book by its cover (lol), the fried chicken had a nice crunch yet still juicy, and the Korean BBQ sauce it came with was soooo delicious. All in all, it's a nice place to grab a quick bite if you are looking for a variety of foods.

vZ8zgpuNUsNJrmSlnV-ghQ.text: Love this place! If you have been to Smallman Galley you know the concept- 4 restaurants, you order cafeteria style and seats are first come first serve. But I like the layout of Federal galley so much better! The bar is an old bank vault located in the middle of the restaurant. It's open on both sides so helps keep with the very open feel. There are several glass garage doors that can be opened in the warmer months. We ordered from Provision (burger), El Lugar (tacos) and Supper (Brussels Sprouts and Poutine). My husband started eating before I could get pics, but everything wonderful. The tacos from El Lugar were my favorite. We will be back to try Michigan and Trumbull. It can be a little overwhelming to decide because everything sounds/looks/smells so good. Just get a drink and enjoy it!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussels Sprouts with bacon jam from Supper
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FScuqN2F9VbA0rC6wFWeBg.text: My husband and I went for lunch this past Saturday. This place is much bigger than Smallman Galley but I prefer the Strip District location since there are so many other businesses in the area. It's generally the same setup as Smallman with the four restaurants plus a bar. I tried the 3-plate taco from El Lugar and thought it was just average. The pork pibil was a little dry but the chicken tinga was nicely seasoned. My husband had The Burger from Provision and he thought it was tasty but not the best burger he's ever had. We will definitely be back to try the other menus.

4TnH0Sp6SUwJ-zhqfostmA.text: We came here after we loved the Smallman Galley so much, and have come back multiple times from the south hills just for the BLT with pork belly. Husband loves it!

zqnPPGPk087RgUtMABKXJw.text: This is worth your time. There are 4 kitchens in the place. We went to Provisions and El Lugar. Chef Steve and Chef Brian with their outstanding crew have continued formula for great food they started at the Smallman Galley in the Strip.   We had the burger from Provisions, one of the best you will get in the greater Pittsburgh area. Make sure you get the fries with this.  From El Lugar we ordered a Seafood Cocktail. The octopus was tender and the tuna perfect. We also had a taste of the house made biscuits in gravy hollandaise sauce, incredible.  The creativity they offer will have us coming back. Our next trip we will try the other 2 kitchens.  Highly recommend.

_FRKzEBhLYCFiCviJDPtEA.text: This is the little sibling to Smallman Galley and Smallman set the bar way high. There's something in Federal Galley for everyone. All one really needs is to really fall in love with one of the concepts and I did. I'm an absolute fan of Michigan and Trumbull's Detroit Style Pizza. One time I had the pizza for lunch, took the rest home and ate if for dinner so I'm okay that you can't buy pizza by the slice. The endless seating here makes this place perfect for groups and they don't take reservations. The other concepts didn't blow me away like the pizza but Provision Pittsburgh has pickled beets that are amazing as I don't like beets and they made me a believer. Supper had vegan ice cream that tastes like regular ice cream and I'm calling sorcery. El Lugar's guacamole left a lasting impression on me as I'm a guacamole snob. In summary just go to all the stations and order one thing from each concept and that's a meal.

XrsfOf9tn8uIjWH7lfWAUw.text: Love the concept. Got a Tuna Melt from Provision. Probably the best tuna melt I've ever eaten.

ptD5WzWZNuPIysi26ezM2w.text: This is a great place to try. They have four rotating restaurants and a full bar. The space is large and they have a spot for outdoor dining when the weather is nice.

GUbGyv2bMz-Iclnzmuh2Tg.text: Food was good, service was horrible. the bartenders allow several men (in our party and outside of) order and walk away with multiple drinks-I watched two men walk away with 8-but they enforced a strict one drink rule with all the women, and weren't very nice about it. Also, upon leaving, my boyfriends tab was lost, or rather never entered. Upon waking up this morning, we find his card was charged 3 separate times. And the prices are astronomical. Will never go back.

aLnf3jyp024O8QLk8-U8zg.text: This place is really neat! It's a cafeteria type style restaurant. There's so much to pick and choose from. The Bahn Mi is delicious. I will definitely be back!

HugtUlR-AHbsxVFCdH-K2w.text: I stopped by for lunch today for the first time. I have always like the concept of multiple restaurants under one roof.   I decided to try El Lugar. I order the 3-taco plate with smoked beef, duck carnitas and pork with a side of pinto beans. The entire dish lacked salt, even the home-made corn tortillas and the beans. I was hoping that the Cotija cheese sprinkled on the beans would add some seasoning to the beans. The mere sprinkled of the cheese didn't add any additional seasoning.  The portion was small as well with little condiments served with the dish, just a tiny wedge of lime cut in 1/2 and a few cilantro leaves.  The taco plate plus a glass bottle (355ml) of Coca-cola cost me $18. I think they can do better than that.

oJJz0eeBNIwLi-SYVg6G2w.text: I only have gone here once, but I really liked it!! I love the different menu choices & I thoroughly enjoyed the signature drink that day!! I liked all of the food I ordered! I liked the atmosphere & I intend to go back!!

ClbV2GrchXp4w2mO1erorw.text: Came here on a Saturday with a friend to check out their beer garden. They place was a little tricky to find and hidden in the midst of an apartment complex. The vibe here is very much like food co-op with several bars and 3 food booths inside selling pizza, burgers & fried chicken, and tacos. They have good beer and my friend had a mushroom burger, which she really enjoyed! On nice days, the patio becomes a mecca for dogs and their humans to come and relax outside. Beers, four-legged friends, and good company - what more could you ask for?!

RynGs6sbE9Z2xlzn7e1eWg.text: This is the second time I've been to Federal Galley. My first time was for a yelp event and decided I definitely needed to come back. I love the idea of having multiple stands to order from all in one place.  I ordered the huevos rancheros from El Lugar. It was really good. Zero complaints about it. I also ordered a mimosa from the bar. Mmmm.  My only complaint is Federal Galley is supposed to open at 10am and for some reason on Marathon Sunday they decided to open at 11 but this was not posted anywhere that we could see. There were a ton of us outside waiting to get in. Next time they should just stick to the regular hours.  Regardless I'm sure I will be back. I need to try the burger!

YTPLNMn-s0D6dYM34078UQ.text: This is an excellent place for lunch and drinks.  The concept is unique in that it has four restaurants in which to chose.  You go to one or all and place an order and they will bring it to your seat.  My wife and I always sit at bar and enjoy some delicious beverages.  The draft beer selection is huge and they have varieties of all types.  They also have mimosas, mix drinks, and wine if beer isn't your thing.  The atmosphere is very laid back and loud.  The crowd is diverse and ranges from families with kids, young couples, and even business folks.  Give this place a try, you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy Cauliflower w/ Blue Cheese on the side.
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo Pizza w/ Pickled Red Onions
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco Plate (one beef, one pork, and one fish) w/ Salad.

aQCS7UepNHtklcNoAp02zg.text: This place is pretty impressive. Went here on a Friday afternoon and it was pretty busy. It's huge, there's an abundance of outdoor and indoor seating. We had a dog so we found a barrel outside to stand at. The bar is great, they had a ton of draft selections. I think I hit happy hour because two beers and a wine were $11. They had four options as far as food, I chose El Lugar. The food was excellent, I went for the taco plate so I could try a few different types of tacos -- personally my favorite was the chicken over the pork and beef. The staff that were making rounds outside were very nice, clearing plates and bringing water for our dog. Overall a great experience, will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Lugar

AOWnXhTwYNL0bUVFcNxb8w.text: I love Federal Galley, and Provision has always been my favorite restaurant.  However, I was disappointed when the kale dish I ordered this evening was delivered with zero kale in it. In the grand scheme of life, this isn't a huge deal, and mistakes happen. What ticked me off was how it was handled.  The main ingredient being kale, it would've been good business to either change the listing or remove it from the menu. The fella who took my order, (with only the faintest courtesy as it was), failed to mention the switch. It was the only thing I ordered, and there had been no line to distract him at the time.  Upon bringing this to the (*manager's?) attention, it was explained that there's a kale shortage, and it was replaced with field greens. I got a "sorry", accompanied by an unconcerned shrug.  But as this wasn't Burger King, I would've really appreciated an offer to switch out the dish for another, a refund, or even a complimentary slice of bread or something for the lack of communication.  I'm not looking for a handout, just service that fairly matches the atmosphere and prices. I'm also in the service industry, and I'd never treat a customer like that. I really hope Provision raises its hospitality game.

cu3Of9_DaYTnDfif3uMWZw.text: The concept here is so cool-you get to try food from several different restaurants with different styles of food all in 1 huge space. There is a ton of indoor and outdoor seating. We chose to sit outside on the back patio, which has a resort feel with umbrellas, lounge seating and a bar area. We tried food from all 3 of the restaurants-a buffalo chicken pizza, loaded nachos, and burgers and fries. The food was delicious, but super greasy. The cocktails were fabulous. This is the perfect spot to eat before or after a ball game because it's so close to PNC Park, and it's perfect for larger parties. It doesn't quite compare to Smallman Galley, but I'll be back to try more food.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2Ls4WKn3_F6vopQvVirfBw.text: After falling in love with Smallman Galley over the last couple years, I couldn't wait to try Federal Galley! I have been here twice -- once for drinks and a second time for a Yelp event. The environment is totally different from Smallman. Smallman has a tight, busy, gritty feel while Federal Galley is open, airy, industrial, and laid-back.  I really have to applaud the bar. They offer both excellent craft beer and also create amazing cocktails. I am not typically a fan of an Old Fashioned but love the version that they create here. The drinks have really surpassed my expectations!  Finally, regarding the food, I have only had Michigan & Trumbull pizza a couple times. Don't expect Iron Born pizza (like I did) as what they do here is similar yet different. My favorite pizza is the Packard Pepperoni, which is topped with an incredible mix of sweet and spicy, including the pickled chiles and hot honey. Their Teader Fries also shouldn't be missed, which taste like an amazing combination of BBQ chips meet Chick-Fil-A fries.  I am looking forward to returning to Federal Galley in the future and sampling more food from the other restaurants.

HmmRFbWxq_VGc9qmUYu4qg.text: I'm losing my mind right now seeing all the five-star ratings on this page. Are you kidding me? I'm assuming that people are giving this place 5 stars because it looks nice inside and outside and I'll tell you what, that's True, but it stops there. Ok, the food looks nice too. And that's about all. I've eaten at all four restaurants and they are nothing to write home about. Actually no, I could write home about a meal that was okay. These meals were actually all pretty bad. The Mexican place for example, I had the tacos. These were a joke. While the plate looked really pretty, everything tasted like how I assume bland cat food would taste. The chicken had no seasoning, not even salt. Isn't this supposed to be Mexican food? Where is the cumin? the chili powder? the pepper??? Anything?? Come on at least let there be salt? No. Same went for the guac and the salsa. I'm guessing if you're somebody who just likes bland food you must like this place. so I'm assuming that everybody that's given this place five star reviews just likes to eat bland food. So if you like bland food you'll like this place too, but for the rest of us that are used to eating seasoned food with actual flavor of the cuisine you're expecting, stay away. Another time I had some burger thing from the burger place. I don't even remember what the burger tasted like so obviously it wasn't that good, but I'll tell you what I do remember, the oil fries. Fries that were clearly left in the deep fryer for way too long such that each fry was completely soaked and sogging with oil, and there was barely any actual potato left. I am getting annoyed just thinking about these past experiences and how this place got as high reviews as it has, so I'm not even going to bother with what I experienced at the other two restaurants. I'm just going to end with this. if you are somebody who likes food for the sake of your Instagram and you like to go "out to eat" for the sake of sitting somewhere festive and fun with your friends, then yeah, Federal galley is perfect! but if you're somebody who is actually looking to eat the food that somebody serves you and leave feeling satisfied in your belly and taste buds, then you should definitely, DEFINITELY, go somewhere else.

pjYODXxOBFK4mYQcyYVZoQ.text: Enjoyed eating here! 4 different restaurants all in 1 common area along with a bar.   There are water and glasses at each table. Once you order, you take a number to your table where the server will deliver your food. When you are done eating, they will come take your glasses and dishes from you. You don't have a designated server. Everyone works together. You pay for your meal upfront at the specific restaurant you order at.   Seems like this place would be busy during the summer months!   This restaurant is more of a high end cafeteria and is so refreshing than the regular restaurant. Provides an alternative to still going  out to eat but not having to spend an arm and a leg.

UnQQA5PSDgYP-P9WSz39sw.text: Awesome dining at the federal galley! Several options to chose from and plenty of seating. Food was delicious. I found some of the items to be pricy for the amount given but quality was superb. Awesome restaurants, definitely will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

72WhWxFDYGcs-fRCWch9pw.text: I truly love this place so so much. We are so lucky to have not just one, but two of these incredible restaurant incubators + full bar concepts in Pittsburgh. If you've been to Smallman Galley in the Strip District, Federal is just the newer, bigger installment of the same concept. It's a little tucked away in the North Side but there are multiple entry points from both the front and back side. The back side has a huge, long grassy area and then a ton of outside seating, both long communal tables for shared seating, and also some larger chairs for lounging. The inside is a large, industrial type building with super high ceilings and exposed ductwork. Same idea as Smallman but isn't quite as jam-packed. Inside you'll find four different restaurant concepts, full bar with 20 + beers on draft, wine, and rotating cocktails. Order and seat yourself at one of the many large tables for communal seating. The four restaurants inside are all killer. Provision - which was an original concept in Smallman Galley - is now at Federal whipping up the same American fare: incredible fries, burgers, and sandwiches, just to name a few. Suuper is super super vegetarian and vegan friendly, with items like tofu scramble and falafel. Michigan & Trumbull is yet another Detroit style pizza and I cannot say enough incredible things about them. Their original vegan pie with the walnut romesco and eggplant was so delicious and unique, and now you can custom any pie vegan with their red sauce and endless toppings. This is the perfect place to accommodate larger groups, families with strollers, etc. The restaurant concepts continue to keep things interesting with new specials as well. Such an awesome addition to Pittsburgh and the North Side.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dessert from Supper. Peanut butter ice cream and the vegan peanut butter banana option. Pretty tasty.
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan pie and pepperoni pie - both outstanding!! 10/10. Can&#39;t wait to get back for more.
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provision fries. They were honestly so salty we could barely get through them.

FEW-eZ60RjiAYEIwz0UlWA.text: I really love this new idea of sharing space to let multiple restaurants co-exist. Federal Galley is another win, like the Smallman Galley, you go up and order and then they bring you your food. We went on a Sunday, so it was not packed. I ordered a chicken sandwich from provision and it was AMAZING. It reminded me of chicken that I had at Pono Market in Kauai (which was my favorite thing ever). My husband got the pizza, it was similar to iron born, but a little more flavorful.  They were out of A LOT of the beers that were supposed to be on tap, which was really annoying, but overall great experience.

Mt37l0OSQgY4Hc1dqPFCzQ.text: This is a great place to bring people from out of town or if you're in a bigger group. There are 4 different restaurants in federal valley so there is something for everyone.

1eWM0ZUh2yY88XjEHy5fUA.text: Federal Galley is a hidden gem.  The concept they have is amazing and a new trend.  Who would've thought that an old bank would make a great bar/restaurant place?  I only know this because I spent time talking to Joseph (the bearded bartender) and he was excited to tell me about this place.  I have come back several times and look forward to seeing him and hearing about his life.  He knows the industry and I trust his judgement when it comes to serving me a drink.

Grplqg7yCGbBP_hW6P2QMA.text: This is an interesting place. Fabulous idea. I'd say that one of the places where my husband and I ate was fabulous. We had an absolutely amazing and incredibly unique dish that was a vegetarian poutine. The vegan cheese was so good and creamy, and the lentils (in place of actual gravy) we're absolutely amazing. Very salty. However, the place called Supper was atrocious. The food was bland and dry. The bread was cut way too big. The chickpea fries were so bland yet incredibly salty. It was awful. It's a real mixed bag, but it's a fun place to try out!

umUe9UlEIZWnRfToPXz_VA.text: Happy hour is awesome!! Service is great and there are puppies for you to pet outside!! Would love to come back!

HpMAm37e_uHSPDowei1TwQ.text: Great pizza from Michigan & Trumbull -had special -hot sausage with spicy vodka sauce and pickled chilies-it was fantastic! Best pizza I have ever had. Also tried Crispy cauliflower from Provision-it was good, but not crispy. So many things I would like to try from other restaurants. Will come again!

Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pmWkqFWx2CLEOnzz28hQ6Q.text: Federal Gallery is awesome! Food is great and there four good food options . Plenty of seating indoor and outdoor. Big Bar is a plus. We ate at El lugar and Provision Pgh. Both were excellent. Had the Bahn Mi from Provision- yummy and incredible fries. Definitely recommend. Had nacho with many interesting things on them- very good!  Check both of these places out!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great Food and Atmosphere! Ate at Provision and El Luger- both were fantastic.

CXywp6ijDWM66BDlE62Lcg.text: I described this place to my partner as a classy mall or school cafeteria. The environment and ambiance here is very minimalist and simple. It's the restaurants that are truly the stars here, at least at the place where I've eaten. I think that's exactly what the creators of this restaurant incubator wanted to do.  Getting to the best part: the food. I've eaten too many burgers to count in my life, but I have to say that "The Burger" I ate at Provision PGH was among the best.  That's right. It was one of the best burgers I've ever eaten in my life. And it wasn't until after I got it that I knew it had a cult following.  I asked for it to be cooked medium. It was probably a little under cooked for medium, but it was the best mistake the could've made. The burger itself was filled with flavor, the toppings, with included cheddar, umami aioli, and smoked mushrooms, complemented this masterpiece. The fries I came with were delicious, seasoned with herbs I couldn't quite point out and amazing fry sauce, which I'm guessing has a thousand island dressing base but I'm not 100 percent sure. I may have also dipped my burger in that sauce a few times. It was tasty!  Lastly, the happy hour here is great. The deal is half off drinks from 4 to 6:30 p.m., so on my first visit I was able to get a cocktail for $5, and during the following visit, I got a Victory beer for $3.50. Normally I opt out of getting drinks out, but here I couldn't resist.  My biggest complaint is the location. I found it kind of odd I had to walk around weird concrete buildings. Street parking is the closest option, but it's still at least a five-minute walk to get there, unless there's another parking option I don't know about.

N0yvSvql6QeFGR8dAk6Fkg.text: El Lugar killed it! Some of the best nachos I've ever had. It is insane how much pork they put on the nachos. Worth every penny. Very friendly staff also! You could easily feed three people full meals with just one nacho.

1G8JLeAEo-s3tLoE2rgGxQ.text: Love the atmosphere of Friday Night at Federal Galley.  Had some great cocktails and tasty street tacos from El Lugar.  Neat place to visit. Probably even better in the Spring when it warms up a bit and you can sit outside.  Only down side is it can get a  it $$$.

93SMV5AESFerNITcI7-mNg.text: Stopped at Provision PGH (inside the Federal Galley) with a large group. We all ordered "The Burger" with fries as our side. For the large amount of people we had, the speed of service was surprisingly & pleasantly quick. The fries were excellent in the special dipping sauce served with our plates. They were cooked perfectly, crispy and brown on the outside and soft on the inside.  The burger was fantastic! Perfectly cooked, well seasoned, and a great balance of flavors. You do NOT need ketchup with these bad boys!  Overall, Federal Galley has a lot of new, fresh choices that all looked appetizing as I saw dishes pass by to other diners. Next time I'm in the PGH area I will keep this place in mind!

DJzqRrfmqzAsk1Zq15ggjQ.text: While I love the ambiance and vibe of Federal Galley (the bar is an old bank vault--COOL!), this review is going to be focused on Michigan & Trumbull, one of the awesome concepts currently in residence at Federal Galley.  I am newly obsessed with Detroit-style pizza. Seriously cannot get enough. After trying out the wares at a Yelp Elite event recently, I had to return for more of what Michigan & Trumbull has to offer.  I ordered the St. Aubin Sausage pizza, an order of the Teader Fries, and the Garlic Knots.   The pizza featured some delicious sausage, broccoli, and red sauce. The crunch of the broccoli brought everything together and the fennel sausage had the perfect amount of spice.  The Teader Fries are out of the world--just like your favorite BBQ chip but better. But the best part is the house made ranch sauce for dipping. I want to bathe in that ranch. I want to top everything that I eat for the rest of my life with that ranch. If I drowned in that ranch I wouldn't even be mad about it.  Finally, the garlic knots. These would be better described as garlic rolls because they are much bigger than other garlic knots I've had. Doused in garlic butter, these garlic knots were out of this world. Perfectly golden brown but incredibly soft in the middle, if I could use one as a pillow at night I would, but in the morning it would be gone due to sleepy munching...  Michigan & Trumbull is fabulous! I'm going to be holding my breath for them to get their own brick and mortar restaurant and then I will live there.  Thank you, Federal Galley, for sharing amazing food with Pittsburgh!

ZnM90vEB53QPorcqq-Anqw.text: I love this place. Absolutely LOVE it - and I keep coming back.  The set up of Federal Galley is, well, a galley. Much like Smallman, but far more spacious with ample room to move around and it's far easier to find seating. The bar is in the center of the layout and there are cafeteria style tables set up around and outside in the courtyard of Allegheny Center.   The pizza at Michigan & Trumbull is awesome and I absolutely recommend trying one of their specialty pies to really get a multitude of flavors. My favorite is the Packard Pepperoni - who would think to put honey on a pizza?  The tacos at El Lugar are great too. To get the full flavor experience I recommend getting the taco plate, with different meat on each of the three tacos.   And finally, my personal favorite - the item I keep going back for - the bahn mi at Provision. Wow this sandwich rocks. And the duck fat fries... the best fries I have EVER had. With pickles and jalapenos and crispy pork on the BEST BREAD, what's not to love?  Last I heard, the contracts for the four restaurants are only a year and I think they're coming up to that year. I'm not sure if they have all renewed them or not, but I recommend making the trip soon just in case!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bahn Mi from Provision - amazing!

G6WKjPBGg6z9m7xH5v3TQQ.text: To say that I'm excited about Federal Galley being open would be an understatement. It's about 3 feet from my apartment building and more convenient than I ever thought possible. I went with a group of friends and we ended up trying something from all of the four concept restaurants. It was easy to order and they give you a number to put on your table and then bring the food over to you when it's ready. The happy hour is also a fantastic deal considering it's 50% off beer, wine, and liquor from 4:30-6:30 every week day. Everything we ate was fantastic and I will most definitely be back again.  I had a Detroit style pizza from Michigan & Trumbull. It was delicious and the perfect size for one person. Not too big and not too small. For dessert we shared the tres leches cake from El Lugar, and wow. I think I have a new favorite dessert. If you haven't tried this yet, you definitely should.

pzl97_n6RY45lQUu4Nh6yg.text: Industrial feel. Young hip and diverse crowd. Expansive food options. Visually appealing. Overpriced drinks. Little bar seating. Cafeteria style dining. Limited TV access, Minimal visibility from bar seats.

BotkjcXtx27KnKOJCq9Hrw.text: Federal Galley is a smash hit. It's everything you love about Smallman Galley, but with a few differences.   Some of the newly departed chefs from Smallman are here, for example,  Stephen Eldridge and Susan Cope from Provision.   We had a lot of fun ordering from mainly Provision and Supper. They both featured great vegetarian offerings.   The bar sure has some excellent craft beer on tap. I had a hard time deciding, but eventually settled on Dairy Potter, an American Double / Imperial Stout style beer brewed by Pizza Boy.   It's a very engaging dining experience, one that I highly recommend.   The high ceilings provide an expansive space, while Smallman Galley, especially in the bar area, can feel more cramped.   We had fun ordering dishes to share. I hope you enjoy your visit as much as we did ours.

Lw97HyqFBTFHrMIMLfX3LA.text: It's opening day at Federal Galley and the place is already booming. The concept is similar in some ways to its sister establishment Smallman Galley but also different in its own way.  I got to meet with the general manager Geoff Zak who explained the concept and was very attentive to my needs. The Federal Galley works with established chefs as opposed to student chefs over at Smallman Galley. These chefs are not term limited and can renew their lease as often as they wish.  Set up right behind Nova Place in what used to be a former PNC bank building, "the vault" is used for the bar area. Happy hour starts at 4:30 and runs until 6:30. The bar hosts 25 craft beers,a Philippine inspired cocktail menu, and wine. Free WiFi is available here.  Let's meet the current chefs. First up is Provision Pittsburgh and El Lugar which is run by Stephen Eldrige and Susan Cope. Although this is the same Provision Pittsburgh that was part of the first "class" at Smallman Galley, Stephen told me that the menu has now completely changed and they are offering more sandwiches for lunch. From his love of the southwest he also runs El Lugar a Mexican concept using PA farm cheeses and other farm to table ingredients in his diverse menu.  I then got to chat with Kristen Calverley and Nate Peck, the main chefs at Michigan and Trumbull which specializes in Detroit style pizza but not the same as Iron Born over at Smallman. They also have a vegan pizza and eventually plan to go gluten free. Last, I had the opportunity to meet and chat with Vincent Perri from Supper.  His specialties are vegan and gluten free but regular meat items are on the menu as well. He told me he eventually wants to do catering. I saw all the restaurants had healthy options to their menus.  I decided eat from "Supper" I ordered a black bean veggie burger on a potato roll and a side of Brussel sprouts that included baked grapes and spicy pecans. Like Smallman Galley you are give a number to take to your table and can sit at any of the long tables with water bottles. I did ask Geoff about beverages and while the chefs offer their own beverages, there is no ice tea. There is no coffee place set up but they eventually hope to get a coffee bar.  I got my meal fairly quickly. The veggie burger was cooked to perfection but very messy!! Glad they have plenty of napkins! The Brussel sprouts were out of this world good. I was glancing at some of the other meals and yes take out is available. Everything looked so good!!!  I wanted to get a chocolate chip specialty cookie from Provision but time and my full stomach wouldn't allow it. I'm happy for this new concept and am looking forward to returning. Parking may be a bit of a problem since you are limited to street parking and the pay garage under Nova Place. Federal Galley also sits in front of the Children's Museum. They are open 7 days a week and offer brunch on Sunday

AJk3g1zx0FzhJVbuCCGTqA.text: The venue was better than the food. I finally got here after work. It an awesome modern upscale food court with an outdoor patio with seating.   - I tried the pancakes with walnuts, just ok. - I tried the Vegan pizza, was just ok, flavors were a little off. - I tried the coconut bread pudding with plum sauce the flavors were off.  4 stars for the venue,  3 stars for the food. I'm sure the food will change but I wasn't blown away by anything and the flavors were a little off.

u3X_cUYRpqgMu96riR8CUA.text: Federal Galley is open, and it's here with some fantastic new restaurants and a spectacular Happy Hour! This is literally across the street from my job, so I was STOKED when I heard about FG opening up! I love Smallman Galley, and Federal Galley is on par with it... It even feels more spacious! Happy Hour is half off drinks, and who doesn't love that? I tried Wild Shrimp and Chicken Tinga tacos at El Lugar, which were quite tasty. I'll be back to try Supper, which I've heard great things about! This place is the perfect thing to open up in the area... A+ for Federal Galley!

XSDDbNI8t1nGCuILX6MeYQ.text: Love this new addition to Pittsburgh North Side! Such a great place to come with friend during the summer. They have a big patio and a huge lawn to enjoy. Not exactly sure how many different restaurants are in Federal but there has to be at least 5 or 6, plus a full bar as soon as you walk in. The dinning area is shared with all the restaurants, it's communal concept. They truly have something for everyone here. I'm vegan so I ordered the vegan pizza and it was delicious! I ordered from one place and my friend ordered from another. After you order you get a number then you pick a seat anywhere and they bring you the food when its ready. With so many different options there has to be something you will like, go check it out! Parking can be tricky but street parking only.

H5C9BJ-sDXQxQdliwadzkQ.text: The newest addition to North Shore and Nova Place, Federal Galley is an incubator for chefs to display their culinary visions to the public. The concept is very unique: stop by any of the restaurants, place your order, pick up an order number, grab a drink from the bar (half off from 4:30-6:30pm daily!), and have a seat.   Upon entering, you're greeted with the warm glow of Edison lights and a spacious (I mean, really spacious) interior with a modern and rustic vibe. During my first visit, I grabbed a Pandan Express from the bar, a pepperoni Detroit styled pizza from Michigan & Trumbull, and a Tres Leches cake from El Lugar.   The drink was fantastic, strong, and quite inexpensive during happy hour ($5.50). We were all amazed at just how quickly the food came out. From ordering, it only took about 10 minutes for everyone's food to arrive! The pepperoni pizza was absolutely incredible. The dough in the middle was perfectly fluffy and light and the edges were crispy and lined with delicious caramelized cheese, and the pepperonis crisped and curled up into tiny little pep cups. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! Lastly, the Tres Leches cake was absolutely divine - while it may look dry and dense at first glance, it is anything but. Soaked in dulce du leche and condensed sweetened milk, your taste buds will be enlightened with the strong vanilla notes and melt in your mouth cake texture...I know I'll have dreams about that Tres Leches tonight.  I can't wait to return to Federal Galley and try out everything else the restaurants have to offer - everything on all the menus looks very interesting, and after eyeing up everyone else's food in the Galley, it all looks incredibly delicious. The chefs are incredibly passionate about what they do, and you can tell from the friendliness, the time and effort they put into their food prep, the flavors, and especially the plating.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pandan Express
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour menu as of 12/20/17. Everything on here is half off from 4:30-6:30

_XQkagkxLqLYeRTytA4-vQ.text: I love the federal galley. There are so many options to choose from. every time I have something different. Its like visiting four restaurants with one visit. Many times I have ordered from multiple places to complete my meal. I also love their bar. They have a great happy hour and the best old fashioned drink in Pittsburgh. You can get a traditional one and also a trendy old fashioned that they normally create. Some of my favorites are  pizza at Michigan & Trumbull and their arugula and lemon zest salad, the impossible burger from Provision PGH  and the chickpea fries from Supper.

uNSuuXB01fYTCtN7Zrqknw.text: I had the pleasure of checking out Federal Galley this past week by attending a yelp event. I've had it on my list of places to try and I was thrilled when I got that opportunity with Yelp.   The place itself is tucked in behind the Children's museum and it can be a little confusing to find the first time. Upon entering there is a big open space with multiple tables, the 4 dining selection are off to your left, and the bar sits towards the back. I was instantly impressed with the set up of this spot. It was very modern and spacious.   While waiting for the event to begin we started with some drink samples which we were both very impressed with. They certainly aren't stingy with the alcohol! My personal favorite was the banana old fashioned. I'm a sucker for all things banana and I love a old fashioned. Who knew they could pair together so well?! I would definitely love to come back for their happy hour 4:30-6:30 some day with my coworkers.  While I had the chance to try something from all 4 places, there was one place that really stood out above the rest and that was Michigan & Trumbull. The pizza was so delicious that we ordered a pizza to take home with us. We clearly weren't the only ones with this idea because numerous people got in line to place an order as well. The pizza is seriously out of this world good. The thick dough with the caramelized cheese covering every inch of the pizza. I only tried the white pizza but I'm definitely looking forward to coming back to try the pepperoni.

lK9io-H9ZHPM_6hhadmopw.text: This place totally kicks ass! Four different restaurants in a collective with a bar located in a super cool Locale.  Had THE BURGER from provisions and it is in the top three burgers I have ever had in my life. Detroit style white pizza was killer good. The caramelized crust is unreal. Also had tacos from the Mexican joint and they were killer and a side of chips and salsa were super fresh!    The fries from Provision topped with lentils and pickled onions were super.

Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kGIDA1ScX5TBPouvxD94LQ.text: I had planned to go to another restaurant but got stuck going here instead just because it was close and I didn't want to pay for another lyft.  It was okay and had a *few* vegan options but they certainly weren't great.  I didn't care for the atmosphere either as it was kind of loud.  Seems like the type of place that would be good for happy hour drinks but just wasn't what I was looking for.

f8m_9beBOhfEsMcq2GMfwQ.text: My fam and I decided to head here for a Friday night dinner. It was very busy, but there's plenty of seating and the food comes out pretty quick. I'm a huge fan of the Federal Galley and Smallman Galley's concept- basically a food court for hardcore foodies. There's something for everyone, and there a tons of GF, vegan, and vegetarian options. All of the restaurants inside are super creative with their food.   First, I went crazy when I found out that Provision PGH would be at the Federal Galley. I had their food in the past at Smallman, and I was impressed. Of course I ordered there! I had the burger of the moment with a side of fries and dipping sauce. The burger was so juicy and flavorful that I could even eat it plain. The cheese and pork belly on top was excellent. There was also egg salad plus greens with a special sauce on the bottom of the burger. It was extravagant. The fries and dipping sauce ARE ADDICTING. If you're getting a sandwich or burger as your meal, then fries are an absolute must. I'm not much of a french fry or potato person, but these fries are incredible. The lentil fries are UNBELIEVABLE. Also a must have at Provision. Add a fried egg on top and boom you're set!! Thank me later. The pork belly appetizer was delicious too.   I was highly amazed by the food at Federal Galley. Next time I come here, I'll probably try the taco restaurant or something from Supper!

Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lentil fries from Provision (front) and vegetarian sloppy joe with salad (back) also from Provision

U72fHIPYlWRVz4g1jLLN7w.text: This place is right next to our office so it's convenient for us to head there for a post-work drink, or sneak out during lunch for a stress reliever. We've become regulars there.   The bartender with the beard is so unpleasant to deal with now that we won't even go in if we see him working. We don't cause problems. Usually we're in there when it's slow and I personally tip well because I was a bartender throughout college.   This guy is just a d*ck for absolutely no reason. The other bartenders are always great though.

mB6ldKm5Loko2YqB3XKOwQ.text: Federal Galley is basically a sophisticated food court with a central bar and four food vendors. It's a massive open space and there are two big outdoor seating areas. We popped in for brunch and it was very busy with a mix of locals and tourists of all ages. You order and pay from the vendor of your choice and they bring the food to you, if you want drinks you order and pay for them at the bar and take them to your table. We did have to wait a little for our food once we had ordered it but when it did arrive we were very happy. We ordered from El Lugar, my husband had a chorizo omelette that came with roasted potatoes and homemade tortillas and I ordered a dish of that was a kind of cross between nachos and chilaquiles made with tomatillos, potatoes and black beans served with a sunny side egg. The portions were large and the prices were good. Federal Galley is I believe the sister business of Smallman Galley in the Strip District.  It's a great concept and I like that you could go with a group of people and all order a different style of food if you wanted to.  As well as Mexican, there is a pizza shop, a sandwich shop and a casual new American style counter - something for everyone!

4Fvgq58DUD44maovo9ei1w.text: Different restaurant than I've ever seen, not even sure if I should call it a restaurant? Anyway, the food was very good. I was very confused about the layout of the place however. There were different stations with different restaurants I believe, and it took me and who I was with a while to understand what was going on. Overall pretty good experience, not a five-star experience though.

ReYOX4pTJ8zpAWlLGRxADQ.text: Will not go back after an awful experience with the bartender. Being a prick isn't necessary, and mistreating customers after being a prick is unacceptable. We understand that to serve alcohol you need to be sure you're following laws, but the manner in which you do so is up to you. Hipster bartender with a beard refused to serve my husband, fine, then proceeded to ignore me at the bar while serving my friend next to me under the guise of 'first come, first serve'. He then told me they were out of my selection, which I'm fairly certain was bogus. Unfortunately, the extremely poor experience with an arrogant bartender coupled with our mediocre food is not enough to bring us back for a second try. FYI: to the bartender who thinks he's an attorney, there is neither a "right to drive" nor a "right to drink".

fioL7A9XHyWD1KUveUK-AA.text: My husband and one of my sons checked this place out over the weekend. It was a great choice!  It's like a food court for foodies and it includes a bar!  We ordered a cheese pizza from the pizza place. It is Detroit style. It had a very thick crust. It was four squares of pizza that was fresh made. The crust is dark and has a crispness. It tasted  like garlic bread. It is covered with cheese and then topped with sauce. It's some of the best pizza I've had. We got Pork Nachos from the Mexican place. It was a HUGE pile of Nachos. There were lots of toppings. The Pork was tender and tasty. I ordered biscuits and gravy as well as duck fat fries from Supper. We inhaled the duck fat fries. Yummm!  If you go you HAVE to try them. They come with a great dipping sauce but I ate them plain. The biscuits and gravy was ok. It had a sweetness to it that I couldn't identify. The gravy was on the thinner side. The biscuit was on the small side and very dense. It was really good.  We enjoyed the communal sitting and bought drinks from the bar. I talked with one of the young ladies who woks there. She said on Friday nights it is packed. She said that their patrons were more suburban types than hipsters. There were all types of people there including families.  We can't wait to go back and try more dishes.

si2DvbJvYX7Qhk6JDvsXNA.text: Band was too loud so my girlfriend and I left after 10 minutes.

O-ZMFxcO5B2qWxrlGGEUnA.text: Was a fan until tonight. Came in on a Saturday night before a show at the new Hazlett theater and it was closed for a wedding. It seems odd to have an event in your entire venue on a busy going out night especially when Nova place has plenty of separate event space literally steps away. There's no place right next to the federal galley as a second option. It's one thing if there was an emergency but this was planned ahead of time and no accommodation made for customers coming in. It was on Facebook but who normally checks Facebook to see if there's an event going on at a restaurant? There were several other irritated people coming in at the same time as us and I wouldn't be shocked if they won't be back again either.

bNpvIW1JJXKYVWlNZNDmxA.text: Cool concept with good food. Pizza, hamburger, and tacos were great.  Poutine was just okay. Went with big group after the children's museum on a Saturday and it was  packed. Kinda trendy and a lot of hipsters hanging around but all the workers were extremely nice and the service was fast. I wouldn't say it's not kid friendly but being that close to the museum they are missing out on an opportunity.

lcDgW-g-cD3zLoPXQ93u2w.text: Had the pizza from Michigan & Trumbull! My Michigan born husband said is was perfect style pizza. The white pizza was delicious

uz_C5P8rpFbbjK4tNoKbSA.text: Really cool environment, with a a variety of places to choice from to go and eat. Also has one of the best happy hours in Pittsburgh.

P7xNLstsDKIi2q3Cv78ekg.text: We just visited the Galley tonight, for the first time. The atmosphere is fun and convivial, and even though it was a bit loud (crowded with people having a great time), we had no trouble hearing each other. We're vegetarian, so we stuck with Supper and El Lugar, with slightly mixed results. From Supper, we chose the Vegan Press, which did not live up to its description.  The ingredients were meager and flavorless, and did not seem "pressed," just sort of squashed (no pun intended).  From El Lugar, we selected the "guac," the brussel sprouts, and the Veggie Picadillo Torta, all of which were delicious.  For dessert, I really wanted to try the ice cream sampler from Supper, especially the vegan banana peanut butter flavor.  The non-vegan ice creams were wonderful, but the vegan one was so salty, it was inedible, unfortunately.   The beer was fabulous.  I would totally visit again, there are so many choices.

ND6YxrO9eImDi335AKr0tA.text: My girlfriend and I stopped by this cool little place yesterday, it was a Monday. We went to the bar for a drink and the bartender told us a little bit about the place. There's actually multiple little restaurants surrounding the bar. So we grabbed our drinks and walked around looking at the different menus, they ranged from exotic pizzas to poutine fries, and even some seafood. Even though it was closed yesterday there's a pretty big patio outside that I'm sure fills up with nicer weather. I would recommend a stop at this place for a night out in the north shore.

hW6SPfsuKt2cNz0KL8AV1A.text: I've been here twice now- the first time I came for brunch and got pancakes which were amazing.  They were the closest thing to True "made from scratch by mom" pancakes I've ever had in a restaurant.  The next time I went, it was for dinner and i had the "detroit style" pizza.  I'm generally not a fan of thick crust pizza, but this was an amazing exception.  I've never had any pizza like it- the cheese baked down the sides of the crust was to die for!  I got the white pizza and loved it.  Can't wait to come back and try more of what these different chefs have to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

23Ojez1aeYygkAOi-C9epw.text: Meh. The venue is excellent and space clean, comfortable and a good crowd. We ate at Supper for brunch. Was okay - nothing special. The guy taking orders was really rude. We were the only ones on line and didn't get a greeting or any kind of chat as all.  Just doesn't really make sense to me. I would think that if you're trying to launch a restaurant concept that you'd want to explain to people your point of view, what you're looking to do... talk about the menu, etc. They really had no interest at all whether you were interested or not. Same with other vendors... Nobody on line and yet as you stand there they dont interact... A simple "Hey there, what ya looking today... You should try our X." Or, "Can I answer any questions?" would be great. Oh well. Also parking is kind of hellish.

g_CKObPwG1KLdigOPuXUQQ.text: Excellent space set up for differing tastes. Went there for Sunday brunch and had some amazing food from el lugar and provision. Food at both places was amazing and tasty. Chorizo omelette and potatoes was bomb. Coffee at the bar was excellent . Draft list was solid and amazing choices for all.

TNsptaIJ9VZzwjtt5hijMA.text: Totally amazing. Just as wonderful as the Smallman Galley. Food was incredible. Had the fried chicken korean BBQ sandwich from Provision....mmmmmmmmmmm.  Service was spot on. Drinks were perfect, Joe is by far one of the best bartenders in the city. The biggest problem here is trying to decide from all the amazing choices. It's a difficult dilemma that you'll have to solve by repeated and frequent visits.

kwb_TDG3fy7YBP7f6_9PWA.text: Excellent selection of food from the various restaurants houses in the location. I love the casual vibe of the place as well. It is great for groups as well.

SjNVchX6-mq8bl4WSQ4Dig.text: Federal Galley is a open floor plan of different foods and beer! My friends and I met here after work one day. There's a lot of seating, inside and outside, with a bar in the middle of the area. There were two different options of food for us to check out - Mexican or pizza. I had a taco platter with chicken and fish tacos (3 tacos) and the guacamole. The guacamole was different - it has some fruit pieces in it! I really enjoyed it though. My friend has a pizza and was torn between two kinds. The woman at the cash register suggested getting both, half and half, and my friend was grateful for that suggestion! I'd definitely come back here again! Parking became an issue because there isn't a parking lot, but that didn't take away from the experience. I recommend this place for a large group of people since there are different options for people to choose from and bar with different drinks to please everyone!

yYxiSdggxbifAlFK-OZ5Qw.text: Similar concept as Smallman Galley, but I think the drink choices are better here and the food choices are better at Smallman Galley.  Slick modern space with many young professionals.  I wouldn't think twice about coming here for an after-dinner drink.

oVt9pu5kSsA5h6TD6aPjVw.text: This is an awesome concept. I'm a fan of being able to have your pick of multiple styles of food in one area, and I love supporting up-and-coming restaurant concepts while stuffing my face. I like that they have one central bar as well. The bar always has 25 different craft beers on tap, and always features multiple local breweries. Ample seating, including two outdoor seating areas. I enjoy coming here for brunch on the weekends, or meeting my friends for a weeknight dinner. Nobody can complain about the pick because they can choose from four different restaurants! We did a pizza/beer pairing here with Allegheny City Brewing and Michigan & Trumble, and that was so fun (not to mention delicious). Highly recommend!

lWb-9_Hrx8Lz6WyIzIiTvg.text: Duck fat fries and garden pea falafel from supper.  Preferred falafel to the fries (I don't usually like thick cut fries but good -we were sharing otherwise doubt I'd gone for these).   cauliflower first from provision.  The cauliflower was amazing. I love buffalo wings and cauliflower so perfect combo for me. Def would order this again.   Also ordered chopped salad from el Lugar.  Good salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Qrt31baE-5yrqtXA29J_MQ.text: To those who have been to Smallman in the strip district before, Federal Galley will be a familiar experience. So let's get down to the food... The Packard Pepperoni pizza from Michigan & Trumbull was completely delicious.  I never knew I wanted a spicy honey on my pizza until now. I am hooked. For a detroit style pizza I thought it had the perfect ratio of crust to toppings.  There are so many more options here that I need to try in the future. Will definitely be going back soon.

t4fwAL-Z1ct0BEu2-AsRbg.text: Was here during the middle of the day with a friend and the whole place was empty. Giving it 3 stars because I wouldn't come back if I knew it would be so empty. People can usually make or break a venue.  Drink selection was great and for food there were many options, even for vegetarians!  Probably wouldn't go back because it's out of my way and over priced lMO.  Overall, nice atmosphere, decent food. I'd like to see it when ya crowded if I ever find myself back here.

r6MFMXsVYwyDM3pyDo_FOA.text: Great place, fun casual atmosphere.  Something for everyone.  Will miss the Michigan and Trumbull GF pizza.

w4bcowyHX48vEPTdFhT8mQ.text: Overall, I love the galley theme.  I work nowhere near here, but if I did, it would be a favorite lunch spot.  Looking forward to trying out the patio when the time comes.    For dinner, we tried a couple of dinners from Supper and a dessert from Provision.   Supper's squash cavatelli was delicious.  The cavatelli felt more like gnocchi to me, but they were delicious all the same.   The dish was balanced and filling - I actually took 1/3 of it home and used it as a side dish for lunch the next day.    My friend ordered the vegan press sandwich with chick pea fries.   She found it very tasty and appreciated that they had purposeful vegan options (as opposed to dishes with stuff left off or random veggies thrown together).     For dessert, I tried the brownie sundae at Provision.  It was delicious and balanced as well.  Very sweet as far as desserts go, but I'm not much for sweets.  I also tried several cocktails and my companion sampled a few beers before settling on one she liked.  The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable.     Fours stars instead of five for two reasons.  First, we felt rushed out of there.  The website advertises that they are open until 9, but it was not even 8 when they started noisily stacking chairs and closing off whole tables near people eating.  Second, the "suggested tips" at each ordering station.  This is a trend that I really do not like in fast causal restaurants.  Tips are for service - and at the point where I am forced to tip, I have been provided essentially none of that.  If you aren't a full service restaurant (and even if you are), you should price your menu accordingly and provide fair wages - not expect a tip for service not given.

5hssdqMamIUgWTx1Bwg4ug.text: Check. This. Place. Out.   I've been to Smallman Galley in the Strip once for brunch (and it didn't disappoint, that's for sure!) Good options (yes, even for a vegetarian!)  Then I went to Federal Galley last Saturday for brunch. Had some trouble finding it (it's tucked away in the midst of some buildings). Once I found it (I'm directionally challenged, so you might not have as much trouble) I was in awe of the ambiance. Modern and contemporary, clean, open concept, trendy but not like their trying-too-hard. There was plenty of seating, even with a busy morning going on. The TVs had football going. Coffee was being brewed. Beers poured. Mimosas sipped. Scents of eggs + bacon spilling throughout. Pizza being cooked. Everything was intoxicating!   My mom and I split three different options from Supper because we just could not choose between them. We had an order of the French toast, Tofu Scramble with Quinoa, and the Vegan Press with Chickpea fries. Oh my gosh. The French toast was good, nothing really too special but it did satisy our sweet tooth!  The tofu scramble and vegan press...wow. Simply, the best vegetarian and vegan breakfast I've ever had. It was flavorful and simply so satisfying. Yeah, we ordered 3 meals and still I could've eaten probably a whole other vegan press and scramble because it was that. good.   The great thing about the Galley's is you order on your own time, but are still brought out your food in a relatively quick manner. There's no server so its just you and your company, which is really nice. It's casual for sure, but still a nice little outing and treat.   Go to this place! There's so many options, even beyond Supper. One of my favorite places I've been to in Pittsburgh thus far (and I've been here for 3 years now!)

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cSWFhHp4j6OgtlplowxDXg.text: Oh, Federal Galley- how I love thee.   This is new favorite place in the North Side. It's located in the old Allegheny Center Mall - it features 4 different restaurants in open concept social gathering hall.   The bar is the middle of the hall - it's literally an old bank vault. How cool is that? They feature amazing local craft brews, soft drinks, mixed drinks, and etc. There is also a counter on both sides where you can order a drink or gather with friends.   Federal Galley is so neat and clean. I love the simple design and layout. They are getting ready to open up their Bier Garden for the Spring/Summer. The Federal Galley staff as well as the restaurant staff are always so friendly.  It was my mom's first at Federal Galley - so we started with a Woodward White pizza from Michigan & Trumbull. It is simply the best. It is literally my favorite pizza.   We also ordered the Pulled Pork Nachos from El Lugar - they were very good. It came with pickled onions and jalapenos - we just took them off because we weren't a fan. The pulled pork & sauce was delicious. I've never had anything like it.   I'll be back again soon to Federal!

Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

j2Phf4mZib9s7mFcxTp1Ug.text: First time here and we shared a few plates. There were so many things I wanted to try but didn't make it past Provision.  We got the pork belly, crispy cauliflower and the grilled asparagus.  The pork belly was on a bed of kimchi and a few other vegetables. It was very flavorful and yummy.  The grilled asparagus was served with crumbly Mexican cheese and either an aioli or hollandaise sauce but the sauce that it was served with a smoked paprika was incredible. The flavor was amazing!!!  I think it also had some grilled amps with it as well. This was also a delicious dish!!!  Last but certainly not least was the crispy cauliflower!!!  The cauliflower had a little crunch and was accompanied by a spicy buffalo sauce, blue cheese crumbles and some pieces of celery. It was the hit of the table .....  I never made it to the other spots that there were there because well, I had to try these three things. I will be back!!!  Do yourself a favor and go try for yourself!!!  What a great experience !!

4IdrsgOBlLz-sX0wXYY_aQ.text: Went here today for lunch and it was a mixed bag. I specifically went to Provision PGH and got the Korean Fried Chicken sandwich with the side of fries. The sandwich was pretty good, but not fried...it was just grilled maybe. It was a tad messy with the runny sauce, but the bun held up well. The fries on the other hand were sort of wretched in my opinion. The fries are double fried I think. Essentially they are fried till the insides taste hollow and they are all greasy. I felt gross afterwards.   Someone in the group did order the buffalo cauliflower and that was delicious.

A3zosve7z9g17VZNGGo9Qg.text: Like the Smallman Galley, this restaurant incubator includes flavorful choices for all appetites. I had Provision's Fish Sammy which was a delicious and large amount of food! Every bite was layered with delicious seafood flavor! Perfectly seared medium rare with all the right sauces. The restrooms even smelled good!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provision: Fish Sammy

GWk4CvD6tamNhp7hTADofg.text: I love this place! It's an up-scale indoor food hall with 4 "restaurants" or stations and communal seating. There's also a big bar in the middle with a great selection of craft beer. Great place to come after work because their happy hour is Mon-Fri 4:30-6:30 half off beer and cheap mixed drinks. They deliver the food to wherever you are sitting and portions are big. There's also outdoor seating and lawn games. Great place.

E59Xqi2t5gC5aRNWZzoJJA.text: The food here is consistently excellent!   I highly recommend all 4 places, as they all make everything fresh, and are unique.   I haven't had a bad meal yet!    Aside from the food, it is very clean.  There are always folks walking around ready to clean tables.    For as busy as it gets, they are on top of it!

EJqVqL7gQRbvaS9n_5APkw.text: I've been several times since it opened, and I basically worship at the altar of Michigan & Trumbull pizza now. I like going because it's such an easy space to get around in--even if parking in the North Side is a gamble--and there are lots of options.  It's a pop-up incubator kind of establishment, although some of the resident restaurants seem to be clearly in it for the long term. I ain't mad about it, because I like what's there. (Try the french fries at Provision, btw, which are double fried and therefore at peak crisp perfection.)    Tables are long and some are more communal than others. (Think German Biergarten benches.) In the warmer months they have outdoor seating as well. Grab a drink from the bar, a sandwich from one place, a taco from another, and for goodness' sake, try the Woodward White pizza at Michigan & Trumbull. You're welcome.

DVZrfiDcLs08yy30Odg_iA.text: I finally made it to Federal!   Today's visit was part of a work retreat. We arrived around 11:30. The space just opened so it was relatively quiet. Both patios were open and people were seated outside with drinks. My first impression is how large it is. I frequently visit Smallman Galley and anticipated it may resemble the space, but Federal is much larger! It's has the same great tables and menus to give you the same Galley feel.   The bar is really large and right in the middle of the space. They have over 30 beers on tap and a full cocktail and wine menu. The bartender was excellent providing suggestions and samples for each of us.   Federal has four restaurants to choose from. Options range from salads, to pizza, burritos, tacos, sandwiches.... you name it. I really enjoyed how many options were available. I think they menus are much larger here compared to Smallman. My coworker and I decided to split a pizza and tacos. We ordered the chorizo pizza. Incredible! I was doubtful I could love another pizza like I do Ironborn, but they are different pizzas for sure. I'm anxious to compared the red pies in the future. My tacos were chicken and beef. The tacos are small so order two at a time. I was happy with both. My favorite being the beef taco. It's not something I imagined I would favor, but extremely flavorful.   Overall, I was extremely surprised how much I liked it. I really, really love Smallman so I was hesitant to try Federal. While they are similar concepts, both spaces are completely different vibes. I can see myself going to Federal with large groups to enjoy time on the patio this summer.   My best advice is 1.) to park in the Nova place garage. Street Parking was hard to come by today. 2.) go with friends and try a bit of everything! My coworkers had amazing burgers and sandwiches that I cannot wait to go back and try. They also offer live music and a dog friendly patio.

YoOZxqjlTw-B5D2EmWxmuA.text: I'm a big fan of Smallman Galley, so I was so excited to check out Federal Galley this week. I wanted to try everything, but was recovering from eating a TON of food from a weekend getaway and kept my ordering to a minimum. I wanted to try a couple restaurants, so I tried Provision Pgh & El Lugar.   Provision Pgh- My boyfriend tried their fried chicken sandwich (without kimchi) and fries. He really liked the flavor in his sandwich, as well as the fries. I tried the crispy cauliflower. I loved the flavors in this dish, but felt the cauliflower could have definitely been a bit crispier. I also wasn't a fan of the bleu cheese, so I opted to get it on the side. Overall, the meals were good and we were pleased.  El Lugar- I tried their shrimp taco. The flavors were FRESH and so tasty. I really enjoyed it, although it was a bit small for the price point.   I am looking forward to coming back & trying out the other two restaurants!

MVUiymQYogLZlyxFqNlm2A.text: This is a great place to try a big variety of foods. The space itself is quite large, with lots of indoor seating and some outdoor tables as well.   The bar is an old bank vault, with four-foot-thick walls and ceiling. They've made large cutouts along the sides where you sit. Very cool.   Food:  I tried Michigan and Trumbull's Detroit style pizza.  It's excellent. The Packard Pepperoni is a great diving in point, because it's fairly traditional. Don't be put off by the fact that it has honey on it. It works, and it's a fairly small flavor element. The cheese is thick and somehow a bit less dense, almost slightly fluffy. It all comes together with great dough and hot, flavorful tomato sauce.

kfMTZzeVLMmZOD1U6OUXFg.text: This spot seems to be one we keep going back to. They have 2 large patios, live music outside on the weekends, a great happy hour from 4:30-6:30 during the week with half price all their drinks, and a wide variety of food. Every cocktail I try is so delicious. They are creative, aesthetically pleasing and tasty! The bar also has quite a few beers on draft and a well rounded selection and local beers.   My favorite thing to order for dinner is the fried Korean bbq chicken sandwich from Provision. The sandwich is always amazing and the fries just might be some of my favorite fries around.   The set up of the restaurant is easy to navigate and the staff has always been friendly. Definitely a great Friday post work spot for drinks and dinner!

lTAUgjul7gY31Uo_-U7G6Q.text: This was my first time at Federal Galley. Great service and very friendly staff. There isn't much around the galley so if you go, plan on staying at the Galley all night. Bar tenders were nice and made good drinks. I will definitely be back!

fnH7vHaIgrDQJU1xbe4SAQ.text: My wife did a take out order and I had a hamburger and fries. I did not go so I can not review the place or the service at this time. I had a hamburger and fries. The hamburger was made perfectly and was delicious and the fries as well where delicious. I would definitely go to the  Federal Galley next time I am in the area.

4jtBG0ngQ8HtgOaoY04anQ.text: Loved the tacos (El Lugar) and pizza (Michigan & Trumbull) I had at Federal Galley! We found a table right away, and the food came out quickly.  I'd definitely come back for both pizza and tacos. I love the concept of these restaurants and while I also really like Smallman Galley, I think the food at Federal is slightly better. I'd be back for happy hour, lunch, or dinner.

y2sLRhctns-NqkxXWtnlaA.text: Another great spot to come from the Galley concept. Four exceptional restaurants that can't be missed. I'm overwhelmed by the flavors and talent coming from these chefs. I really like all of them but have to be honest and say that Supper and Michigan & Trumble are my favorites. That's not to slight Provisions or El Lugar at all. In fact El Lugar has exceptional sauces and Provisions knows how to make a beet taste incredible. The bar comes with really yummy and original takes on classic cocktails as well as their own. Great layout and decor. Fantastic staff. Cheers!

k-mtk3tR2Ed10k-cOnxnAA.text: My expectations were SO HIGH!  Reviews seemed awesome, Instagram kills it on a daily basis with delicious food picture posts.  Then... I finally made it to FG and have to say that I was disappointed.   The atmosphere is awesome, large open space. And I must say I am looking forward to when the weather breaks and I can bring my pup to the beer garden.  Drinks, were great. Beer was reasonably priced (even more so during happy hour) and I also had a craft cocktail which was tiny yet delicious. Bartender was super sweet as well.  Stop 1 - SUPPER Poutine was great. Even for a Canadian. (5 Star) Black bean veggie burger 1 star. I have never had a veggie burger this bad before. The almond queso was terrible.   Stop 2- MICHIGAN & TRUMBULL Vernor Vegan pizza... was what my hopes were so high for. The dough and crust, fantastic. Toppings were light and I really was not a fan of this pizza at all. The others look much better on the menu, but due to my diet this is the only one I could eat. Flavor was great but with how thick the dough/crust was there needed to be a little more topping wise - after eating this I just felt like I ate an entire loaf or bread.   Stop 3- El Lugar Dessert was fantastic. (TRES LECHES)
