kJMVkp0n_L8JnWdMevoyNQ.text: I love Smallman Galley and really wanted to love Federal Galley. It's a beautiful space, although it's a little hard to get to. Especially on weekends. The issue i have is that the individual spots are fairly pricey for the portions and for the quality. I really hope that they are still working out the kinks in their menus because its a new place. That being said, I would say all the food (we tried 3 out of the 4 places) were severly mediocre. The pizza place was detroit style, similar to the chef at Smallman -- i got 3/4 of the pizza at the same price, less thick and undercooked. The mexican place, i wanted to love. The menu sounded amazing. If you are going to make tortillas from scratch, you better kill it! They unfortunately were subpar and thick. like...very bad. Brisket was dry. Provisions was okay. We got some dippy eggs for my son but the toast was drowning in butter and bacon was super greasy. Perhaps the chefs just need a little time to work out the kinks...

V1Y0TDubRsiMX4SClB6sdg.text: While on the outside it feels like its located in Gorky Park, the food and ambiance on the inside are amazing. When I went I had a pizza. It was Chicago style, deep dish. Good dough, lots of cheese, and fresh premium toppings. Wash it down with one of the many beers on tap and you have a recipe for a fantastic meal.

i1nloQ9v-nhRAXmlTDIMiQ.text: Just a quickie- rolled in here after the Children's Museum knowing nothing and being from out of town. Great experience- ate from two of the four offerings (can't remember names, but the 1st and the 4th as you walk in from side with garage doors). Food was lovely, people were nice, place was kid friendly and it just so happened to be happy hour.  I can't remember the last time I paid $2 for a draft beer. And it was excellent. Totally dug this place. I've been to other places in this 'format' (multiple eateries under one roof with a central bar), and this place seems to function a little more smoothly.

Smv92ISAn2MZp5GuSqFpPA.text: Had the Michigan & Trumbull Pizza. It was  unique and amazing.  went to the bar had a  nice red wine at a goodprice and viewed a beautiful cocktail selection can't wait to go back to try more. It's such a great concept for start up restraunts  and offers a great selection of food. Makes me happy with it's different style of dinning  in Pittsburgh....

VMuk_yk9j5HDL7vns8xB3A.text: My wife had the hanger steak at supper and the whole plate was overpriced,poorly presented, and completely unpalatable! The steak was over cooked     The Brussels sprouts were burnt, and the compote was a spoonful of pureed baby food. The duck fat fries would have been good but they were cold! I can't believe that I paid $23 dollars plus prepaid tip! The tip is before the whole experience! And to top it off we kept getting interrupted by the servers trying to deliver us other people's food. The servers seemed to be very confused were the food was supposed to go. The whole experience was sad to say the least. I would expect that a place so new would try and put their best foot forward, but alas, it fell quite short of expectations. I will not be making a trip back anytime soon.

6N18bPCBlWm6U7Mv43NGnA.text: Right now I really enjoy the mix of restaurant concepts they have in there. It is a good something for everyone variety. We got a bahn mi and some provision fries from Provision. I would love to come back and try the pizza and tacos as well. The interior has plenty of tables, but gets pretty crowded for happy hour and dinner rush. The nice thing about this place though is that you seat yourself so you usually don't have to wait too long if you're keeping an eye on the tables and which ones might be clearing out soon. My only complaint about this place is that it is LOUD. We were there during happy hour and it was loud, which isn't unusual, but after the crowds died down around 8:30-9 it still seemed really loud in there. It actually was one of the reasons we decided to leave instead of hanging out longer. The ceilings are really high and there isn't really anything soft in there to catch the sound, so it just bounces around all over the place.

V0FCVygHE2hXMEXFplHxKg.text: I have been a respectable patron of this restaurant concept, especially since it's a new, unique local eatery for quite some time, until today. There is a weekly food truck roundup held at the building complex, so my friend and I purchased our food from a truck vendor, then went to Federal Galley for a glass of wine/beer. After we ordered our drink, with our vendor food in hand for nearly 20 minutes, we found a place to sit inside. Within minutes a server approached us and said we are required to leave due to health reasons of outside food being brought in. No problem. I ask her what she suggests we should do since we have drinks that are not allowed to leave the premise and the bartender clearly saw we had food from another vendor & said nothing, she said "I don't know, but you can't stay here". She waited until we left our seats; rather embarrassed (to say the least), my friend and I had a few sips of our drinks outside, then noticed the server circling us as well as a few other customers in the same scenario, making us uncomfortable enough to leave.  I will no longer be a customer due to the disrespectful service and will be sure to let neighbors know of this unprofessionally run establishment.  In addition, there are dogs allowed on the outer premise of the restaurant, which I think is wonderful, but please don't be hypocrites and state that for 'health' reasons we can't bring outside food in but dogs are allowed to do their business and sit on benches within the confines of the restaurant. There were also numerous employees outside smoking...if you're going to implement standards, please make it universal.  Please note this is nothing to do with the food vendors inside of the restaurant, just the poorly managed Federal Galley staff.

zrkQibRBvxdD7QjczymUhg.text: I had food from El Lugar. Sooooo disappointing. The red chile is more like watered down beans. Eating them one after there is only a little more spice and same base flavor. Torts is inferior to food truck fare and only 1.5x the price. Beer prices are astronomical.

ZOplqUvJ2sK4LzUornwTHQ.text: Would have been a five star but the bartender (male) was very unprofessional. Thankfully the woman bartender took over and she was professional.  The four food selections were delicious. The  people working took the time to explain the ingredients etc and the bus staff cleared the tables quickly and were very friendly. We won't let one bad employee ruin our review! We will be back!

IgB1taolX4Z6kQaQiDu0gA.text: Bad food and service. Overpriced cafeteria at best. Just, No.

hJY8r56ZEMsUmftFPedNfA.text: This is the most un-Pittsburgh like restaurant ever, and I do not meant that in a good way.  Back in the 'Burgh for a brief visit from L.A.  Went down to FG to watch the National Championship and to grab some grub.  The food was cold and is still eating at my stomach today.  Beer selection was like it was handpicked from a hipster in Silverlake who makes his own brew from pomegranates.  Not one single, you know, BEER.  Everything infused with bee pollen or angels wings or henna or whatever.  All that I tried tasted just.....off.  I can deal with that, though.  Nothing ventured, nothing gained.  What sucked was that staff was chock full of attitude and rude as can be.  Guy who took my order acted like I was keeping him from posting on his blog, and the man bun bartender guy had more attitude than RuPaul during fashion week.  Every request at tasting this line of unknown brews was greeted with an eye roll and a sigh.   Piss off, Snark Man.  Warehouse vide of the place feels like it should be cool, but I found it more cold and cafeteria-like, and on top of everything else, someone kept raising and lowering the light levels like an ADD kid who'd forgotten to take his Ritalin.  Maybe just a bad night?  Possibly.  But I'd suggest skipping this place.

_qf_JCeKICGJqboBdXwFKg.text: I live the atmosphere....very casual yet the food and drinks are great.   I really loved the burger I had from one of concepts.   My friend's pizza was really great too!

kdGK06R92NF0a0lTFcpkIg.text: The food was all truly excellent especially the pork belly! Really fantastic. The atmosphere was fun and energetic and the service was also excellent. Highly recommend for something different and delicious!

43R_u1EJQR6mhTg3zIUqXg.text: Checked the website for hours.  Arrived at 8:00 for dinner.  They were having a private event with no warning.  They clearly don't respect their customers.  I am never eating here again.

8XyF2ldq-FmN07fY5xc3kw.text: Neat spot. Seat yourself, it's sorta food court style, but with a bar. The food is "elevated" (maybe too much?) as it's a bunch of local chefs trying to make names for themselves. The eating area has great lighting during the day from the huge windows and the architecture is modern industrial... definitely fits the city and makes for a great dining experience.

nYhf04395XENSzerBNZ8jw.text: love this place.  awesome restaurants and bar and super confident.  looking forward to the summer when the beer garden goes into place.

qUDo1d2GLX_Tzzo5qc0Xiw.text: Welcome Michigan & Trumbull !!  This pizza is as good as it gets also loved the waffle fries and cilantro ranch dressing.  One of the owners Kristen is so accomadating to her customers.  This  is exactly what the area needs.  Try it it is fantastic !!!!

H5nfI-O5qxjw-VdrihXg7Q.text: It would absolutely be a five star if they had a better coffee situation. The food is great at all four stalls.

C9R6tnJZBMFNuub3apnzHQ.text: The space is great for any group. The food choices were very good and the quality was even better. Beer and drink list was impressive too.

fvZf5iPHMP6PgJ6exSfj2g.text: Supper was superb.  Had the hangar steak and, for desert, the sweet potato souffle.  Both excellent. The steak was cooked perfectly and the Brussels pours were a bit sweet but it worked well together.

SCmpfsUC2oBycdyRHJPi7A.text: The food options and environment are outstanding.. I have eaten on two separate occasions at Supper and it is very creative with high quality ingredients.  The type of food offered at all four restaurants exceeds most of what I have experienced at higher end city restaurants.  Well worth the trip to the North Side

FwSb370oEIzBWRVi5jMiDQ.text: So....shortly after posting my initial review, I was contacted by Federal Galley's amazing Manager, Adrienne T advising that my sunglasses turned up!!  Despite my offer to pay to have them shipped to me, she refused and sent them back to me.  Adrienne went above and beyond her duties, and for that, I am incredibly thankful.    Note, that while the service (Adrienne) is 5 stars plus, I didn't change my 4 star rating so as not to skew the ratings.   Thanks so much again, Adrienne!!  We will certainly stop by to see you next time we are in town.

JkjeMWV-YC8CeO2ssE1p6Q.text: Super Cool and a great idea ! Wish it wasn't soooo far from my home. It's really laid back almost like cafeteria style would be the best way to describe the situation. Love the beer selection and tons of places to eat as well.

LzrkTJtZ6M6hb1rZnKgRqA.text: Finally got around to going to Federal Galley. I thought the whole concept of the place was fascinating and such a great way for new places to make the transition to being a full restaurant. This is a perfect place to grab a drink after work and a meal if you're hungry. You order at the station and then pick any seat in the open area.   I chose the Bahn mi from Provisions with a side salad. The portion was HUGE- easily could have fed 2 people. So you are definitely getting bang for buck there. I will say I wish I would've gone with the fires instead of the salad. I felt like the dressing was lacking something. The bread on the Bahn mi was perfect.  Overall, Federal Galley is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hCajw5wHQVavXX9HywfeaQ.text: So let it be known that I have claimed this place as mine. I dream about the deep fried cauliflower at Provisions. I think about its mild buffalo flavor, crispy edges, those delicious little chunks of blue cheese. The fact that I can choose inside or outside seating and that they are both perfect is just glorious.  I get to order my lunch, take my seat, pour myself some free, cold water and sit while the staff brings me the one single thing that makes me thankful for working in the Northside: Provisions Crispy Cauliflower.  Federal Galley, thank you for giving me something to look forward Monday through Friday.

cPWRIuIftkAl0P181gxa-A.text: Excellent spot for good food and beer in a very relaxed setting. Lots of food choices like American, mexican, Detroit style pizzas and chicken.

f5lMM6Vta2aYoc87CaFRtA.text: This place is great! With four restaurants and a bar, it's a perfect place to come with big groups. I've come for a friends birthday and for my own graduation dinner and it was just right - we got to bring gifts and our own desserts. It's all seat yourself with long tables that can definitely fit your whole party. The place is huge and very modern/trendy with a tall ceiling, outdoor patio, and Edison bulbs everywhere! The bar is rather small and has a specific menu, but there's still something for everyone!  Then comes the food. There are four restaurants that change periodically (not sure the timeline but it's pretty lengthy) and they get to set up in the galley free of rent. (Support small business - woohoo!) My personal favorite is the Michigan and Trumbull - it's Detroit style deep dish pizza that is to die for. Guapo has amazing food, as well! Portion sizes are honestly pretty big from each place so my little tip is to have everyone in your group get something different and everyone eat a lil bit of everything! I'm already dreaming of when I can go again.

JQKMir1TXJaWB2umK1KEWg.text: I'm a big fan of Smallman Galley. So when Federal Galley opened, I was beyond excited to have a similar food hall opening within walking distance of my house. And with an awesome happy hour, a plethora of dining options, and a dog friendly patio, what more could you want?   Well, after a year and a half of visits that have become more infrequent, I can say that what I had hoped would be a neighborhood gem, well, isn't.   Their Happy Hour just ISN'T HAPPY. At least not when Joe the bearded bartender is there. He's unpleasant, to say the least. After a recent "who wants to happy hour" convo with friends, I've discovered that my husband and I are not the only ones turned off by how unfriendly he is. He refuses to engage in even the briefest conversation. He's short with patrons, and I've had experiences where he is just plain rude. I understand that they are busy, but with specialty cocktails and a large beer list, he should consider sharing some knowledge with the patrons instead of blowing them off with a self-serving "I don't know, I quit drinking years ago".   I'll continue suggesting happy hour at the Modern Cafe, where there are half priced beers, plus the bartenders are friendly, fast, and overall awesome.  Or...maybe FG could post the days Joe is off so people can enjoy a truly happy Happy Hour.  On a positive note. The rest of the bar staff is great. And the food options are great. Which Came First? is an awesome new addition, and while I will really miss Michigan & Trumble, I'm looking forward to trying the new Mexican spot.   Argh, why does one bad apple have to spoil this otherwise perfect bushel?

Zc_4O76vAIhxOq2doya7jw.text: I joined a group of friends here tonight and fell in love with the place as soon as I stepped foot in it.  Granted, it was a little chaotic when I arrived at 6 p.m. on a Friday night while the Pittsburgh Pirates were also in town for a 7 p.m. game.  But once the crowd thinned out a bit around 7 p.m., it wasn't as loud.    The atmosphere is pretty chill, and the food options are diverse and delicious. I opted for pizza from the Michigan & Trumbull. It was so good! The drink line was pretty long since happy hour ended at 6:30 p.m. I never made it to the bar.    I can't wait to go back to this place so I can try more of the food.  Portions were huge, prices were fair for the city, and the atmosphere was amazing on this beautiful Friday evening. Fresh air blowing through the restaurant since the doors were open. Lots of groups of people and conversation.  There were about 10 in our group, though, which made it tough to sit in a place where we could all see and hear each other. Tables are long; but this is no different than any other restaurant.   I left in such a good mood after visiting this place. Such a convenient location too!  Check this place out!

fN1DwTH-kWlj37YzuinsyQ.text: I've come here twice now and I loved each experience. Both times I've come have been during Happy Hour. In the middle of the floor is a bar with countless beers, ciders and cocktails. I haven't met a drink I didn't like. I still haven't tried the first place in the lineup, El Lugar, but I've tried pizza and a coney dog from Michigan and Trumbull. The Woodward White is excellent! The coney dog was sooooo good especially for only $2! And I've tried two desserts from Supper. The Cheesecakes were both delicious however a bit more saltier than I was expecting. The atmosphere here is open and free with small and large tables in addition to lounge seating. This place is good for a first date, friends night out or company happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coney Dog
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apple Cheesecake
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy Fries- so so worth it!

Y98KtPdnH9Lnfczb_k_Ctg.text: I just stopped in for a burger it was 5 pm and the place was hopping I think there was a pirate game tonight. It's a pretty big place with a nice bar it's pretty loud and hard to gave a conversation but the food was good and they had TVs if you decide to stay at the bar.

iLcvMCd-XAxwbuR6XROVAw.text: I love the concept of this place and Smallman Gallery. The venue itself is quite nice inside, and I like that they have outdoor seating, though it's just tables set up on cement and not particularly pleasant. We choose to sit inside  I had veggie enchiladas from El Luger. The best part was definitely the handmade corn tortillas! The guac was also quite good, well seasoned without being too seasoned. The enchilada filling was not particularly memorable. The friend I was with got a pizza, which was perhaps a better choice.  I found the prices a little high ($16 including 18% tip), but to be fair, the portions are quite generous

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green Chile Enchiladas from El Lugar

4oT1IAMqDzhftUhRQD1s3w.text: I absolutely LOVE Michigan and Trumbull. I went to the Federal Galley for a yelp elite event and was able to try something from all of the restaurants. But Michigan and Trumbull stuck out the most to me and every time I go there I have too have the pizza! And the arugula salad! I love the salad so much I have no made it a staple in my weekly go to dishes!! Try it out youll love it! I also wanted to note I love the cocktails at the bar area. Each of the bartenders have their own signature drinks named after them! What a cool place!

XVHy7CuNHDWeeWfdDcYTmA.text: Overall, I will speak about the atmosphere at federal galley with high regard, but there are a few things you need to know to navigate this one successfully. On the positive side, the venue and outdoor space are very dog friendly and the few patrons who brought dogs were incredible respectful and caring. The outdoor patio is spacious and well laid out - a necessity for how busy the space gets! Unfortunately, the inside space where the larger brew menu and food options are gets packed and the lines and seating area indoors overlap inconveniently. The layout isn't ideal and the lack of bartenders (or urgency among those they do have) doesn't lend itself well to enjoying time with your friends while you wait in amusement park length lines to place your orders. Be warned that - while the outdoor bar and shorter line is enticing - it has a shorter line for a reason! The cocktail and beer list is limited, and you'll still wait a while only to get what seems like a miniature sized drink. Remember this when placing your order and consider ordering a few so you can spend your time as it's meant to be spent: with your friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy cauliflower
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy cauliflower &amp; cocktails

bSHlQNGJdwD7sDp7jAiN1Q.text: The concept for Federal Gallery is fantastic, and my review exalts this idea.  For a two hour hit, I couldn't sample every restaurant, but I could certainly see myself spending hours here, drinking and tasting.  Basically, a bunch of good chefs opened up "stalls" in a refurbished hall.  Patrons saunter up to the "stall," order, pay, and grab a table somewhere in the large space.  Or, if you're a lush like myself, you grab a seat at the centrally located two-sided bar.  When your food is ready, someone from the "stall" brings you your vittles.  I chose pizza.  It was very good.  Bartenders were great, informative and friendly.    I loved the concept, but found a few pitfalls.  The space is cold and innocuous, echoing a suburban mall.  The food deserves a space that concerns itself with aesthetics and some sense of design.  I felt I was dining in Penn Station below Madison Square Garden.  Also, signage on the outside is akin to what I would see at an amusement park.  I realize we are near the Children's museum and the street is called Children's Way, but Federal Gallery is for grown ups.  If Federal Gallery has a tacky affect, it will have a tacky essence.  Again, the quality of the cooking deserves more.   Yet, I had a great time and enjoyed the food and drink.  Time will tell if the idea catches on.

kG3Wzrr2jsV1t2K5f2eNhQ.text: I love this concept, especially for indecisive people like myself sometimes. There are 4 restaurants, a bar, 2 outdoor patios, and pretty spacious inside.  The pizza from Michigan and Trumbull is amazing. Do yourself a favor and get the white pizza. They have a pretty decent happy hour and the overall vibe is chill. I recommend following them on Instagram also to keep up with special events. You can bring your dog on the patio only.  Now that it's nicer, the outdoor setup is awesome. I have been here a few times and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mmmmmm pizza!! Michigan and Trumbull. The white pizza is sooooooo good!!

Eq8-6jawM275QiStQ7-QAw.text: My boyfriend and I went for a late lunch/early dinner yesterday and were not disappointed! Upon arriving, we parked in the Nova Place parking garage and took the elevator to the Plaza level...once out of the elevator turn left and the restaurant is right there!  There is a great outdoor space and pets are allowed in the patio area...unfortunately with the rain we spent our time inside. The space is huge and provided lots of room for groups. It was also a very family friendly environment...we were both impressed!  We grabbed food at Michigan & Trumbull and Supper and were not disappointed! We shared a pepperoni pizza (amazing), poutine fries (omg you have to get these!!), and the chocolate mousse cake! This was more than enough food to share and we left stuffed!   For those who have not been to one of these restaurants before....you order at the restaurant window and receive a table number...when the food is ready they bring it over! Despite being busy, our food came out quickly and everyone was very friendly!  In addition to our food we got a few beers at the bar. They have a great selection with 25+ beers on tap as well as mixed drinks. There were also plenty of TVs to watch the game!  Overall we really enjoyed our experience and will be back for more! For those going in a group this is a great place to try a few things and share!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UUE7t-ulfaAnmqV5LbNG1Q.text: I visited during a Saturday afternoon around 1:30, after visiting the Children's Museum. It was crowded but we easily found a spot. First, I can guarantee this is much better than eating at the Children's Museum   The grownups had beer and the price was very reasonable ($4 for Straub draft). Great bar service.  My daughter and I split a pizza. I've lived close to Detroit and it is an excellent representation of the style. My mom had a salad and taco and also was a fan. The food from the taco stall took a while to receive (only negative of the experience).  I liked being able to serve ourselves water and the stall service model. It is a beautiful space. Pittsburgh is lucky to have it!

trlveTjidcMxjWbofp7kPA.text: Visiting from NYC came to this place to eat cause of its walking proximity to the childrens museum. I absolutely love the idea of this place. It sort of like a mall food court except it has amazing food and its much nicer.   Very casual. Just walk in, walk over check out what the options are (3 different restaurants plus one separate bar that does have a ton of beer options). After you order, you sit and they'll bring you the food. They has vegan options and everything was super delicious!!   Come!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

S2kByRdZsNqc8q-GLNYlSQ.text: We had Provision Fries from Provision. Had to try fries with butternut squash puree, lentils, cheese and an egg on top. These were the best fries I've ever had. It all worked perfectly. Make sure you get these. It was raining so no outside seating and indoor seating is tight. But worth the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizza rabble from Michigan and Trumbull
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provision Fries

s293XDk10-ACYyZE_RSkTw.text: I've followed the Galley group from the beginning. Smallman was such an exciting concept, I was pumped to see Federal opening up in the North Side. Even more exciting, was that Provision was joining them, a former Smallman Galley fave (best burger in Pittsburgh maybe!).  I like this venue better than Smallman because it definitely feels more spacious, although I hear it's the same size, just different dimensions. The bar is nice and accessible though! I think their bar program might be one of the most interesting in the city, they always go with a fun seasonal cocktail theme and have a phenomenal local beer list.   I wanted to wait to write a review until I ate at each of the restaurants to do a fair assessment. There are four kinds. First I had El Lugar, which is delicious Mexican. I've had a nacho dish and pork enchiladas, which are a hearty helping, I might add. Supper is a great modern American concept that offers a variety of indulgent and healthy foods. I like that they have a lot of gluten free options for me.  The heirloom spinach and veggies is listed as a snack, but it's a hearty helping too, and could totally be a full dish. The strawberry vinaigrette put it over the edge of tastiness. But I had to even it out with the delicious poutine (also GF!). The fries were crispy, which is good when paired with gravy.   Finally, I'm so happy to report Michigan and Trumball has gluten free pizza. I was so sad to not be able to eat anything from there that when they started offering, I was first in line! That crispy cheesy crust is no joke. You could offer me a side of that and I'd be good. But the pizza itself is great. I had to double check it was GF because it tasted like normal delicious thick pizza crust. I just tried the spicy sausage pizza with pickled onions and that had to be some of the best toppings I've had on pizza.   I will note, parking can be difficult depending on the time of day. During workday hours, I usually just try to find parking on street. The NOVA place garage can be dicey. After hours you should be fine with the garage, but it's confusing to navigate how to get to Federal Galley from the inside. Other than that, I can't wait to sit outside in their newly opened patio during the warmer months, it is going to be killer!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Lugar Hot Mess

gHRVYN6hogj8zf_5apRLCA.text: Went for brunch and was happy to see a few of the places had vegan options for breakfast that weren't just your standard oatmeal or a bagel. I had the tofu quinoa scramble from Supper and it was yummy and filling. My only complaint was that figuring out where to get coffee was a little tricky (hint: you have to go to the bar).

y1CssbKKjvAyniCHcQo2IA.text: Fun place!  Cafeteria feel (not the type you remember) to the place and will be awesome when you can sit outside.  Sometimes can feel a little bit cramped and confusing.

8WNxE-a3GNJgJABrHYxeog.text: Decent space. Cool concept as Smallman. A bit more mall cafeteria feeling than Smallman though. Busy which is good. Slightly echoey/loud. Tasty mixed concoctions. Good TVs.

XlMSeD5OH4QCL5MyHYavJQ.text: Enjoyed the happy hour and the food.  As everyone else has said, there are 4 different food places to enjoy.  Will have to make a return visit to try some of the others.  As with the Smallman Galley, the food prices are a little high.  Yes it was busy but our food came out in short order.

29DtQEcN1ZIgS0XRae0NnA.text: Wow, great concept.   I wish I would have thought of it!  My husband and I got dinner at Supper.  I got the sea bass and he got the hanger steak.  Both were very good.  However, we were hungry and should have ordered an appetizer.   We were still hungry after our 50 dollar meal.  We also got cocktails and those were very good, too!  We would definitely go back.   I love what they are doing here.

P5BXWsZUEfxoS_f6nBgaiQ.text: Similar to smallman galley, I do appreciate the idea of restaurant incubator, tho my food experience was not as positive as with the smallman galley. I had pizza which was not bad but nothing beyond basic pizza.  I was there on a Friday night which was very busy and the place gets loud making it difficult to have a pleasant social experience. The beer options were pretty good tho with really reasonable prices at the happy hour time.  Definitely a place to consider if you are around there but with an A-/B+ level expectations, at least at busy popular times.

eZ_ElgwZO0ZUy9q90uM-Lw.text: Ok, this place feels like I'd imagine Google's cafeteria would be like, plus alcohol. The food selection is great, the restaurants try hard, the atmosphere is lively, the bar staff are friendly and knowledgeable, and I love the beer selection. I haven't tried their patios yet, so I'll update my review when I do.

_GDqQxVupgtqOM5rae6CgQ.text: I love the design and layout of this location. I got the poutine from Supper and it was amazing! Overall I do enjoy the food at Smallman Galley more than here but they are both great. Can't wait to come here once it gets warmer and they can open the garage doors!

Qj5nY3ZkXyKrysGSUeQjfg.text: Great addition to the North side and compliment to its sister, Smallman galley. I tend to like this space a bit more due to more seating, and seemingly bigger menus from each restaurant, I'm assuming due to bigger kitchen spaces. They also have a great Happy Hour! Half off their cocktail list and draft beers I believe (It's good, trust me) It's perfect for any type of group since there are so many options for food/drinks/desserts. Everyone will find something they like. My pro tip would be to get a pizza and add the hot honey drizzle. So good. Also the brownie sundae with the chips on top from the taco place, amazing.

9wbQR--6oeNTQ6DnpHD_IQ.text: When I heard that Smallman Galley was going to be expanding and opening a new location called Federal Galley I was so excited and still am because the wait was well worth it. I've only had Michigan & Trumbull but the entire space is wonderful, the bar is great and o Michigan & Trumbull, delicious. I don't think you can go wrong with any of their pizzas, my personal fave though is the Packard Pepperoni. The fries are delicious too, the dipping sauce, ah so good. I will definitely be going back and need to try some other places but will probably still get a pizza on the side regardless :)

tgp4fsZfpqKjBz0nvquURw.text: This is a pretty neat place! Its owners are also the owners of Smallman Galley. It has the same concept of Smallman Galley, where the customer can choose items from different rotating kitchens and eat in a common area (*read as hipster food court, not in a mall)*. The bar is really neat too in that it fitted into the building's old vault, which is fairly noticeable when looking at the padlock door and bulky metal framework around the bar area. Overall, it's a really cool place to visit with a group of people as there is something for everyone!

2yiUmuVAgAz8f-Lkv2-Fnw.text: Noise level on a scale of 1-10; a 12.  Was like eating at an Oakland Pitt student hangout on a Friday night. Cafeteria seating with restaurant prices.

Z6owJ-o7k3wvPiH07FB0tw.text: Love the concept, space and the restaurants. It's different and exciting. The prices are reasonable and vary in range. The poutine from Supper was delicious. I also tried the BLT sandwich but was slightly disappointed. It didn't meet my expectations of a BLT at all. That won't stop me from coming back!

CmvixWhGQAMGDkTYKc-nmA.text: 4 stars for all of these food options under one gleaming sterling roof. Definitely mimicking the kiosk choices at smallman galley. As someone who works in the Northside I'm thrilled to welcome the galley and even more thrilled that they offer lunch hours. Supper had a well rendered sea bass with Brussels and baked grapes. The side of mashed cauliflower was over spiced and could have been better described as cauliflower two ways as most of it was chopped. Additionally I have tried pizza from Trumbulls and was impressed with the inventive pairings like potato and horseradish that is lavished on chewy thick crust. In ambiance, the acoustics are a bit loud so if visiting during high traffic hours be prepared for lots of auditory stimulation... All in all, I am glad to welcome this crew to the nor' side!!

tvsGyuv-KPhfJRravt1tmQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place, having been to smallman a few times before. It has the same kind of vibe, but it's a brighter, more welcoming version.  Great place for big groups, seating style is long farm tables, and the variety of food options would appeal to anyone. Can't wait to check it out with warmer weather, looks like the garage doors open up for almost picnic like outside seating.

mgvJffLIfeh9kFWpCsBh4Q.text: Similar to the Smallman Galley in the Strip this has a great set up and a little bit of something for everyone. Great happy hour. Not cheap but everything is made fresh so it's worth the price. Can't wait to try brunch here.

kaPnFgZmghj4saTos8vW5Q.text: Definitely my go to place for an easy night out with dinner and drinks. 4 quality food vendors with unique menus that will keep bringing you back to try them all. A bar with spectacular service and a diverse beer selection that caters to beer lovers. You may have to share a table with others, but seating is comfortably close without being cramped.

4ohEv0ops3r_AnNfG_wm1w.text: We really loved Federal Galley! It was slightly hidden, but definitely enjoyable. There were a lot of great food options for almost anything you could want! Loved the atmosphere too

_p6g8eu7Aqn_JqNM-EhOpw.text: Provision continues to have the best burger in town. Love Joe the bartender and his amazing humor, not to mention his amazing shirts. Love the place

5YCCywW6lUrih_q16jV5Ng.text: Well, the parking is terrible. I circled the building 5 times before finding a spot! In addition, the service was terrible and my pizza was burnt. For $16.00 and terrible parking, I was better off going to Pizza Hut. What a fail, this is not the place to be!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LxfiY5IpoefWr6GpC_EJJQ.text: I love that the Galley group has introduced the concept of the food hall to Pittsburgh, and has done so with two awesome locations.   Federal Galley is a great space, with plenty of open space and seating indoors, and outdoor seating in both the back and front of the building. The floor to ceiling windows/doors that open make this place always feel bright and happy. The food options are solid (I won't go into too many details in this general review). It seems that the owners do a nice job of rotating interesting and unique restaurant concepts through so there are options for every tastebud that walks in.   My favorite part of Federal Galley? Half price happy hour. What better way to end the workday (or workweek) with a half-priced glass of wine (or cocktail or local craft beer). I have been hard-pressed to find a happy hour in Pittsburgh that I enjoy as much as this one. I also appreciate the live music on the weekend and the many cool different events that are hosted here. Thanks, Federal Galley, for being a beloved staple of the northside!

AqXCCgJLOVOGXMpTao7pEQ.text: We love Smallman Galley, so we're excited to head to the North Side and check our Federal Galley. It's the same concept of four restaurants under one roof, as well as a bar area. I love that there are so many different options. There's truly something for everyone, which is great when you can't agree on what you're in the mood for for dinner!   We ordered from Which Came First (grilled chicken salad) and Shaka (spicy salmon poke bowl). We enjoyed both options, and they were delivered to our table very quickly after ordering. They also offer a great happy hour of 1/2 off all beer, wine, and cocktails from 4:30-6:30 PM. There were only a few options of wine, but an extensive list of different beers on tap, as well as specialty cocktails. The only thing I didn't love at the bar area is there were a bunch of tiny flies; that's definitely not a deal breaker, as the food and drinks were delicious, but just something we noticed that wasn't great.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. General grilled chicken breast salad from Which Came First and spicy salmon poke bowl from Shaka

BgNTyny8av7evxkUR8gbwA.text: Smallman Galley is one of my favorite places in PGH, so I have been itching to try Federal Galley for quite some time now! Love the concept, allowing different chefs to have their time to shine at the restaurant - a great way to get new chefs off and running!  The North Shore location is a lot bigger than the Strip District one and tons of outdoor seating, so much better to go to with groups especially in the summer time. Warning that the location is a little hidden - it's in an almost business park-like area, so have to search a little bit for it.   We went for brunch on a Sunday, and surprisingly it wasn't overly crowded. When first looking at the restaurants' brunch menus, I honestly wasn't overly excited - a lot of it was standard fare brunch options. There was also an underwhelming number of "sweet" choices, which is usually my go-to for brunch. Regardless, we both decided to go for Which Came First, a southern-inspired, home-cooking restaurant which had the most exciting choices to us. My BF and I actually swapped preferences - he went "sweet" with the "State Fair" and I "savory" with the "Georgia Benedict." The State Fair was v unique, with funnel cake fries topped with a berry compote and fried chicken. The chicken had a sweet tinge to it that complimented the flavors of the fries nicely - my BF said this was one of the best breakfast chickens he's had! The Benedict was a unique take on a classic dish, featuring fried green tomatoes instead of English muffin and rosemary ham. The flavors of the ham brought out the flavors of the hollandaise, bringing the dish together. I enjoyed it - not the best Benedict I've had, but tasty. Important to note is that the restaurants themselves do not serve coffee, so was a little confused on how to order. I guessed right that the bar had some - however, it's not listed anywhere, so that's a little confusing. And when I received our coffees, there were not any "sleeves" on them, so it was super difficult to carry them without burning my hands. Lastly, I walked around the restaurant twice to try to find the cream/sugar - finally found it, but that also was secret and only offered the individual creamer packets and sugar-in-the-raw. For such a trendy place, I was expecting a little more robust of a coffee selection, so this was a little disappointing. However, we still enjoyed our overall meal despite!  Overall, we had a lovely brunch at Federal Galley, especially sitting out on the patio on a beautiful day. Definitely recommend up-ing the coffee game for the future to please brunchers. Would love to try for HH or dinner so I can experience other restaurants (while they're still there!)

M1shpLpik79wcX1d5Tqk6g.text: Great lunch visit for all to this bustling food court with a great local beer selection. There are about five food businesses here, clean bathrooms, and a bar that serves up 25 (mostly) local beers on draft.   I had a great meal by Guapo restaurant of New Mexican Carne Adovada enchiladas, served Xmas style with both green and red Hatch chile  pepper sauce. I paired it with a local beer by Cinderstown brewery. The rest of our party of four raved about their food, and it's great to have options when traveling with a group.   There's a front patio, but the back patio looked amazing! Street parking was easy to find. Check 'em out!

XUNdGQKXS49Oxk_Ob8coxA.text: This spot was a lot of fun. It housed a handful of startup restaurants that share overhead and expenses. Everything looked amazing and the concept is novel and I hope it catches on all over.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LqJ81MLaGEXgLR8vFOpRwg.text: What a cool place!  Similar to Smallman Galley.  Easy to miss in the northside since its nestled by children's museum area. You wouldn't know by just driving by.  Parking on the street.  Inside and out seating.   As far as food we only experienced "which came first" was amazing. The bar is cool - offers mixed drinks and drafts.  No bottled beer.    I love the spacious communal seating the dining area and water is provided on each table.  We are excited to go back and try other places..such as pizza from Michigan and Trumbull!!     We will be returning... thanks Federal Galley!

UC4ce1vjxbA61kPOxK280w.text: I was actually not very impressed with this place. We ate from the first restaurant selling banh mi sandwiches. The pork banh mi sandwich had a very odd taste, something about the oil on the pork just seemed off. I thought the loaded fries was a unique idea but the flavors just didn't really come together for me. The Mac and cheese though was very good though! I don't usually get this dish but saw another table's plate and had to order it. My friend said it was one of the best Mac and cheese dishes he's ever had! Otherwise, overall meh experience

U3Y4jbPJrT3Yv04Q3C3Vrg.text: Stepped into Federal Galley and forgot I was in Pittsburgh for a hot second! The outside seating area/bar had such good vibes, and the whole set-up reminded me of something I'd see back home in California.  As for food, I enjoyed the heck out of 'the burger' with fries from Provision. The burger was perfectly medium rare (as requested) with nice sauteed mushrooms, aioli (if a little too much of it), and a fresh sesame bun. The fries were well-seasoned, crisp, and came with a little aioli dip of their own. I also snagged a Brooklyn sour from the outside bar, which was v nice.  Would definitely come back with good company in good weather!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Burger from Provision

yWmbIbAjegk2eAAGFi-hJQ.text: The place so nice we went there twice... in two days! Once again, we had a great experience. Today we took our four year old along with a friend and her daughter. They split chicken, fries, and mac and cheese from Which Came First. All three choices were delicious, but the kiddos weren't into the non-Kraft mac so we got to indulge. We also got veggie nachos from Guapo which were good! It was a great way to enjoy some music from the Deutschtown Music Festival.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie nachos from Guapo
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken, fries, and mac and cheese from Which Came First
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Classic burger from Provision

fMToOm-DBPiwEMmq1oitTQ.text: Love love love this place. The concept for Federal and Smallman Galley is genius. Rotating restaurants every year is a great concept. It keeps things always fresh and new.  Who doesn't love trying new restaurants?! I've never eaten anything bad at any of the 4 restaurants within Federal Galley.  All the restaurants are on top of their game. The food is always delicious, full of flavor, unique items and the food presentation is always on point.  Federal Galley does get very crowded at peak times so it may be a little hard to find a place to sit. But if you plan ahead and go a little earlier or little later you'll be ok.  Keep up the great work Federal Galley!!

KS2uEqhKpofUt4BUC_pOCQ.text: Still a super solid place for group meals! We went a couple days ago and tried the two newest restaurant concepts. Which Came First has delicious onion rings and their chicken looks phenomenal. My boyfriend and I both loved Guapo, the Mexican concept. I had the braised beef guacamole tacos and he had the shredded chicken quesadilla. At $15 a piece the entrees seemed a little pricey for Mexican food, but given the freshness, flavor, and generous portions it's well worth it. Both entrees came with home fries and beans, so he left super full and satisfied and I was able to eat a third of mine for lunch the next day.   Iron Born and Provision are still going strong as well. Provision made my mother seared rare tuna and chips in lieu of fish and chips due to her gluten allergy, and the Iron Born pizzas were a hit with our whole table. If you somehow haven't made it out to Federal Galley yet, I strongly suggest going. It never fails to be a crowd pleaser!

_X9oWygZNLBd3OC0IkhbDw.text: I've been to the Federal Galley a few times and have had items from all but one of the restaurants. I really love the open space there and the availability of tables. I knows there's always a big debate between federal and Smallman and I always find myself picking federal over Smallman because it's bigger and there's so much more space. (I do like Smallman too though!)   Provision- The crispy cauliflower is soo good! I would definitely go back and get that again. It was hands down the best thing I had here. We also had the asparagus was just ok. My mom also had the pork belly and she raved about it!   El Lugar- I got the taco plate with the side salad. The side salad was fresh and light. I got the chicken taco, shredded beef taco and the fish taco. The taco's were good, however, I thought the chicken taco was a little bland. I've also had the chopped salad which was go good!   Which came first- I got a wrap with grilled chicken Nashville style. It was so good. I'd go back and try more from their menu! My sister got the Nutella French toast and enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella French toast
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco plate with side salad

0MVwwkt673tmlmXGFq7gIQ.text: Food options are good but I find myself getting the same thing every time.  Love the outdoor space.  The beer selection is good but the line was too long to wait for a drink.  Snapped pics late in the meal.  We had tacos and vegan pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6VDSgBTeXAUwsfD1kWI8Rg.text: Neat place with multiple up and coming restaurants inside. Great bar selections. Not hard to find but parking seemed tricky. Definitely would go back!

FFkTnRroDpNCV1ii_mYRRw.text: Love this place for happy hour/dinner! The rotating restaurants have something to offer for everyone's taste. The mac and cheese and pizza were some of our favorites. The vegetarian tacos were a little disappointing (and small). The outdoor patio seating is great for the summer

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Funghi pizza, Mac and cheese from &#34;which came first&#34;, tacos from El Lugar

bKJ2HDaqAtq-BSPVJ7W7dg.text: Interesting concept but poor execution and way overpriced. When you enter, it's confusing and not clear how the place works. A simple sign would have been very helpful. We started with Provisions for burgers and fries for the kids, but the burgers were almost raw and they don't have ketchup for the fries. The pancakes were thin and dried out. Portions were good and the fries were OK, but you only get tiny little ends for some reason. They also charged us for coke instead of water (we didn't know there was water on the tables because of the confusing system they have) and when we asked to fix it, they couldn't. The employees didn't know how to work the register, so we got stuck paying more for their mistake.   We then got a burrito from the next place and it was both huge and very tasty. I'd stick to the TexMex option if you visit. The final meal was from the Chicken place and for $15 I was expecting something better than the dry, over cooked, mess that I received. The onion rings were as close to tempura as Pluto is to Earth. We got a Pho to go and it was certainly hot and looked good, if pricy.   I am fine with overpriced trendy restaurants, provided that the food is great. With a few exceptions, the food here is mediocre and priced about 50% more than its worth. It took a long time to get the food as well, and the place was empty. I can't imagine what it's like in a busy might. Luckily, the bar was well stocked and beer was reasonable, $3.50 for a draft is about the going rate.

86nesYVLhuHOq6vLwdi6NQ.text: Came here recently for dinner and loved their outdoor seating. A great place to go when the weather is nice! My friends and I decided to share a variety of items. We had the mac & cheese from the new "which came first", which was delicious. It was super cheesy and had a nice flavor. Also, at $7 it was so worth it. The fungi pizza from Michigan & Trumbull was also phenomenal. Their crust is just delightful. The tacos from el Lugar were the most underwhelming as they are pretty small. Overall, a great place to come when the weather is nicer and for larger groups of people. Will definitely be back this summer!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos, pizza, and Mac &amp; cheese!

78329Gdb8cY7JDZQtfDA-g.text: On a Friday afternoon, we didn't get surprised to see a crowded place. No waiter service. So, we found a table by ourselves ( was not so hard) and ordered our meals from the temporary restaurant booths arranged in a food court style. I ordered from a restaurant-concept named Provision. I ordered Hamburger of the Moment. Mitra ordered Ditroit-style Pizza from Michigan and Trumbull. Our ordered dishes appeared on our table in a timely manner. Both dishes were so tasty.  Overall, We enjoyed our visit and meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Detroit style pizza  Tasty
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hamburger at the Moment  One of the best

WDauswXQZu48LOBfTSallA.text: I love this place. If you didn't know, they have four rotating restaurants inside. Place an order and find a spot inside or outside and they bring out your grub. If I could, I'd come every weekend for happy hour and check out each place. Dog-friendly (yesssss), and boasting a wide variety of craft beer and cocktails at half price for happy hour 4:30-6:30, in addition to the up and coming restaurants in the area, Federal Galley has what you need.   5/5 for ambiance. Bravo.   The restaurant we went to was called "What Came First" which specializes in you guessed it, chicken.  The General - 3.9/5 A little messy and confused in its identity, it's a cross between a gourmet chicken sandwich and a Chinese takeout experiment gone awry. Entirely too much sauce with a less than desirable amount of the other interesting toppings mount a giant chicken breast. For $13 (no sides included) it wasn't the best.   The Gabagool - 4.3/5 This one was better. Same chicken breast but with a slab of fresh mozzarella, marinara sauce, and Italian meats, this sandwich was more manageable and tasty.   Mac n Cheese - 3.2/5 Does every restaurant slather cheese sauce over *specifically* cavatappi pasta noodles now, toss a higher price on it m and call it a day? I'm getting sick of it. The noodles were clearly from a box and the sauce was gritty.   Value 4.4/5 Come at 4:30 for the great happy hour and unique food options. I think they have music at 7 Thursday-Saturday as well. Stay for the dogs.

YPChOSLjFg1_W-hILQO6PA.text: I love coming to Federal Galley on the weekend when thing are really hustling & bustling (I know that's the opposite of how most people feel). To me it just feels good to be around other people who enjoy food.   This last Friday was no different. My partner and I ordered food from Provision and El Lugar. The burger was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. The seasoned fries and sauce were equally as good.  We got a perfect seat at the bar where we ordered the great drink (The Frankie) ordered below. The current signature cocktail menu is comprised of high school photos of the bar staff and special drinks the concocted. Frankie the evil genius behind the rum powered drink was actually working that night. We got a chance to chat about her travels and inspirations.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Frankie: (Serves 3-4)
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Provision: For the moment burger
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El Lugar: Shrimp Taco &amp; Pork Taco

AsHCF7MLXbrx1y1aHuTu9g.text: Well we finally made it down to try the Michigan&Trumbull Pizza and we couldn't have been happier. The only downside was parking and that was because we didn't know where it actually was. But the garage is close so that was very minor. The pizza was amazing and definitely Detroit style. The atmosphere is very similar to Smallman Galley but I like This one more. We ordered the Farnsworth Funghi, St. Auburn sausage and the waffle fries. The dough was very crispy on the outside but perfect in the middle, the fries were done just right with some delicious seasonings. The ranch was excellent as well that came with the fries. The bar was cool in the middle but the service was less then impressive. The bartender was rude and not helpful. By luckily that won't stop us from going back! Can't wait to try the other chefs creations!

x-UPmODpkIU_Tprv1pP-3w.text: Great selection of different foods to try out. It's a great place to go with a group so you can try lots of different things! Nice draft selection too. On a nice day, the patio is perfect and they are dog friendly. Drinking a beer with a dog next to you is the only way to go!

YaqBCUE5QNF5gsb-dbuWkg.text: Food was excellent and so was the service! When in the area this is a great place to get great food and worth the price! I would highly recommend this place to anyone! Very clean and well kept restaurant, bathrooms also very clean, always good to know when you are traveling!

F9oWK7u9esYzVPTwj036ng.text: Lots of options. Tons of seating. Great beer selection at the bar in the middle. There is really no parking though.

JD8d9ZSudDhL4fmsmF0LfA.text: The Pittsburgh food universe is a divided set...some love Smallman more...others Federal. I get it...it's a tough call. Me? I have to say, I love Smallman more than Federal and prefer the intimate setting. I can't help it and love how cozy it is! However, they are very different spaces and that is not to say that anything is bad about Federal Galley. My boyfriend loves the open atmosphere and the higher chance of finding a seat with a group of people. I've been there a couple of times but really have only eaten at Michigan and Trumbull and Provision. I don't feel like I need to dote on the pizza, I am sure 99% of these reviews gush over it. The Provision burger though...oh my. Smoked mushrooms and umami mayo, yes please. I really do want to try Supper and El Lugar and really have no excuse for having not. Everything that comes from Supper looks amazingly beautiful. My friend ordered their eggs benedict that uses fried eggplant as the base. It looked insanely pretty and he really enjoyed it.  Overall, it is a great option for food, a wonderful addition to the North Side and a wonderful place for friends to gather.

rouih3YiZlxueYCzYv0SHQ.text: Federal Galley in Nova Place is an awesome spot to try all different types of cuisine.  It has a lot of open seating and a fully stocked bar.

JdVhiW-eegsGWrnu6mbKyw.text: Getting here was a little bit of a mess. The address listed here is different than google and is different from the address listed on the receipt... So after wandering around finally found it. So that was not fun...  Once I got inside, it was packed as it should be on a Friday night. Didn't even make it to the bar because the crowd was so dense around it and not moving. That kinda sucked.  The food was good. A little expensive for the portions but still good.  Will try again but definitely not worth all the hype...

T-xThN1crduKVNOrEFTLDA.text: I had been wanting to try the Federal Gallery for weeks after a friend moved to a neighborhood nearby and I saw it's lovely patio, hanging lights, and overall great atmosphere. I was told prior that the food was "all right" "okay" and "not bad" but I was starving and prepared to revel in its deliciousness. Turns out, however, that these descriptors are very accurate, which made me a little sad because everything else speaks of hip gourmet (including the prices - $14 burrito much?). They were so darn close! Just add some more spices to your chicken, some onion, chillies, give your pintos more flavor than a whisper of tomato, and don't expect guac to do the heavy lifting! The food felt like if somebody cared just about 40% more, there'd be nothing to disappoint.

LkEN6bih0Q1OsDrBOuGvHA.text: Awesome place to meet up with friends and grab a drink! Came here for brunch with my friend and I got a BLT from Supper while my friend got ham and eggs from Provision. Both meals were very filling and you definitely get your money's worth! Awesome beer selection and cocktails too. Only reason I give this 4 stars is because it is tricky to find parking and also it was hard to find where I could buy a cup of coffee.. I had to ask multiple people which area of the Federal Galley I could buy a cup

P8_84bhckQ7LiCc9fuU4HQ.text: Great open atmosphere and the outdoor beer garden opens mid-April! Lots of variety to pick from in both food and beer

-pXKGJnFwyEjD92rCTRKNw.text: We're big fans of Smallman Galley and we were excited about checking out the North Shore space for Federal Galley. The space itself definitely met our expectations--it was bright, with lots of windows, and a great bar with service on both sides. Lots of tables, including some larger communal table seating similar to Smallman. The place is open and bright with an industrial feel.  We visited Federal Galley on two occasions--once for dinner and once for Sunday brunch.  Our drinks were great. Wonderful beer list and cocktail options, and we enjoyed everything we had from the bar. The one exception is that, during a breakfast trip, the coffee was really disappointing...basically coffee from a big container served in a paper cup, nothing like the amazing coffee they serve at the Smallman Galley location.  We had items from all four restaurants during our two visits.  The pizza at Michigan and Trumbull was probably a highlight in terms of food. The Detroit-style pizza, with a thick and slightly crisp crust, with the St. Aubin toppings (broccoli, sausage, creme-fraiche, and cheese) was excellent.   El Lugar was more disappointing. Their tacos were not particularly exciting and lacked that great balance between the freshness of toppings and fatty/salty meat that we look for in tacos.   We'd all had Provision before, when they used to be at the Smallman location. Their best bets remain their burger and their crispy chicken sandwich, which are consistently excellent. Their specials, entrees, and brunch items are sometimes a little more inconsistent.   Supper was also a little disappointing. During breakfast, they ran out of biscuits or something, so they just brought out the dish with toast instead, but it would have been nice to know that before purchasing. Eggs lacked any seasoning at all and were underdone. Their poutine was good, but their hangar steak dish was, again, underseasoned and weirdly balanced.   Staff were super friendly and helpful--always scouting tables to see if water carafes need replaced or dishes need cleared.

x751RpGDmne57OZtN_GsGg.text: Great concept and a great space! I am a big fan of Smallman Galley but I get a little claustrophobic in there, so this really worked for me. I recommend going on a sunny day and eating on their patio.

ySFKs0nO79jjLn-_jNjy7g.text: Awesome environment!  I would highly recommend it for groups. Beer selection is all local craft, food is quick and delicious. Crowded, but imagine it will be better once outdoor patio is open.

ib_YPmqkWX0ZfVNSQieu1g.text: The acoustics in this place are terrible. It's so loud and you can hear everyone talking. They need some sound panels or something. The food I got from provisions was mediocre. Meat was good but all the sides were literally cold

0fCV2-oMU7Xvon7ZcqqwUg.text: LOVED this place! Highly recommended for brunch. Many food and cocktail options and the outside seating is the best

glAtDzHefwQta1m3Fnvkng.text: Went here to meet a few friends and visit my favorite bartender, Franny, outside on the patio.  Great beer selection!  Ordered the Blackened Swordfish and Arugula salad from Supper and they both were excellent!    The only reason I gave it a 4 is because you have to be in the mood to serve yourself and not be waited on.  You have to go up to the counter to order and get your own silverware and drinks.  Other than that, it's a great atmosphere and nice place to take your dogs and kids!

62t2jmD6KVNXdmSEasQy3w.text: Federal Galley must have problems with underage drinking. IDs required for each beverage purchased, no matter how old your party is. If your mom wants to go to a "cool happy hour" for her birthday (Happy 62nd Mom!) and you (in your mid thirties) try to order drinks for both of you, the bartender will go out of his way to make you feel dumb for violating protocol. Mom left her wallet at home, which led to a stupid game of drink-passing. Next time I'll make sure my retiree parents have proof of age, though there won't be a next time soon. There's a way to politely explain policy (that understandably keeps your business legal and operating), and there's an off-puttingly rude way to do it.

M8UXIythRqR32Z9ma7Edag.text: Federal Galley is such a cool space, with even better food! We had the tacos & salad and chips & guac from El Lugar. They were outstanding! The guacamole had goat cheese in it, which was delicious. The bar also has a great happy hour with half off drinks! Definitely worth checking out.

xEZtcjeXCIxrr17eAYVjEA.text: This place is fantastic, it has something for everyone. Mexican, Pizza, American, tons of gluten free options, tons of creative veggie options. Whether you want to fatten up or you're into eating healthy, there's plenty of options here. Usually, when a place tries to do this many different varieties of food, they don't get any of them right. But this place is different, they've put 4 restaurants under one roof with a really cool bar to finish it off. There's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. We visit Pittsburgh often, this will be one of our staples.

5_xkyEvetmfYfYXWg-ZVHg.text: A great place to meet up for a drink or happy hour. Large bar, with fun and delicious drinks.  Food vendors are rotating so I would say to check online to see who is there if you are thinking about going there strictly for food, though they always pick some great food. It is great on a nice day, food and bar staff are great and efficient.

4FkaQMRnbVi5y5HUCe-Bug.text: Fantastic pizza at Michigan and Trumbull!!  Loved the crust!  And the fries were excellent. The drink selection at the bar was very nice - plenty of craft beer and a local cider.  We will be going back.

XdTaeFyKbG6G6EHkVcemEA.text: Be still my heart.  Having this Place this close is pretty dangerous.  Have been here twice in two days and in terms of space and food selection, I think this tops Smallmans current offerings!  Have been to supper twice and it is stellar (don't let average sounding names fool you), the pizza place, and el lugar which were also good! Thank you for a wonderful addition to the north side!

WYTkALOK-9nd4Zmfm9O5Jg.text: I am hesitant to say this as it's already busy enough and I work in Nova Place, but Federal Galley has one of the city's best happy hours.  A superb tap list gets pared down to affordable prices.  If that wasn't enough they stock a great bar and can make the classic cocktails I crave.  Pair all that with several food options (average to good) and you have yourself a great spot.  For the tip if you see me, give me a high-five.

_hHMrhDLowYMIXklNUewog.text: Great selection of drinks at a central bar.  4 different restaurants, great gluten-free options.  Portions are large!  The triple fried fries were the favorite at our table:). The gluten-free pizza was wonderful.  Great space.

7sRzzeDrA8w4sg1XuUxicw.text: A decent stop in Allegheny Center. The food was alright, the atmosphere felt kind of crowded even though it's a pretty open space. Perhaps on another day it could've been 5 stars but my experience was pretty middle of the road.

tSSsXMZGWzb2AQ9-gcPvSQ.text: What an awesome place. The variety of food is amazing. The best part about this place is the Bar. Their cocktails are very creative and well thought out. And the beer selection may be one of the bast draft lists in the city. A great mix of local and national breweries.

je716xC1Z3deV_2mCAY3mw.text: I was enjoying some food when their ac unit started dripping on my food, I didn't realize that's what it was, and I moved. Started getting wet again. Moved again. Got wet again. Realized it was the ac system, and was pretty grossed out, and wanted to get new fries, so I went over to the pizza place..whatever, Michigan and Trumbull, and the manager literally said to me "if it happened to me again, I wouldn't sit there, and uhhh erm I hope you come back", uh doi, I just moved 3 times. I was like yo, I'm dippin....I figured she would offer something---like new fries---or an apology maybe, but nothing...just a to-go box. I called federal galley the next day,left a message, no response. I wrote an email, no response. This is absurd and I won't be back. Girl, bye. *edited after response from mgmt* Thanks for reaching out to me, Im not going to reach out again, as I did--twice, and I'm not going to ask for anything. My email address is cnmendez@icloud.com, or you can message me on yelp if you'd like to. I appreciate the apology and I'm glad that this was a recognized issue and it was resolved on your end. And if Eric C from slippery rock see's this---I wasn't making up a condensation story to get free stuff---and look they fixed their ac problem :)

xEwOiYFA6Ha76SQKVNfejg.text: Stopped in at Federal Galley the other weekend while I was in Pittsburgh, and was not disappointed! I had a burger and fries and a beer but unfortunately cannot remember the name of the business that I got it from. There were maybe 5 different food vendors in there and it was a great ambiance. On a Sunday evening was not very easy to find access into the building but still made it work!

dzjxn3Dw2ygdlAz-7zY6KA.text: It's great! Don't come here without getting provision fries. The green Chile enchiladas are awesome and the buffalo cauliflower is something I think about often. The pizza is great too!

BPptB1Wf9CaxGiVQOrJ-vg.text: I had been dying to try FG since my super memorable visit to Smallman Galley!! And after one visit I already can't wait to go back!!   After literally having a dream about the Provision buffalo cauliflower, I knew I had to get it again. It was as wonderful as I remembered, the perfect balance of spice, crunch, and creaminess. My hubby tried their burger and fries. He never makes a big deal about food and wouldn't stop talking about the fries being the most amazing he ever had. I had to agree!! His burger was also very, very good!! The meat crumbled in your mouth which is my favorite kind of burger!   I also knew I couldn't leave without trying the very Instagrammed MICHIGAN&TRUMBULL. I went with their FARNSWORTH FUNGHI because every single thing on it holds a special place in my food heart. It did not disappoint. It was the perfect pizza. Gooey, salty, crunchy, amazing. It's going to be hard going back and not getting all of the above again!!   Oh and the beer during happy hour is so cheap!! The one I got was only $3!! $3 for Southern Tier is unheard of!!

M_k-DV3eN0AzT-4Qvh3HRw.text: This is a nice place to go if you have a party of people who want variety. There are so many different kinds of food and you all can order as you feel free at different stands. The staff are friendly and a waiter even came over and gave my daughter a free ice cream. So nice. We had our meeting here and it wasn't hard to find a big table for our party. It's not very loud either. Really good happy hour specials. And kid-friendly which is a plus because I almost never am able to go anywhere without my daughter.

QENDJp0MpQ_1KZBsPKtZIw.text: If you like Smallman Galley in the Strip District, you will love this place.  There are 4 chefs with chalkboard menus to choose from.  The space is really open and has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  There are about 25 beers on tap (menu from around the Burgh!!).  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the location.  It is kind of tucked away in the North Shore by the Children's Museum away from most other popular locations.

oJgM69GFwJzeRBhNlUd3Jg.text: Federal Galley has such an open, modern feel. It's a great place to catch up with friends over cocktails, especially over happy hour being all drinks are half off. One of the waiters over heard my question wondering about the specials and kindly greeted me and told me about the happy hour specials. She went out of her way to address my question and was extremely nice. I will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I got the shrimp and chicken tacos - the shrimp was definitely my favorite. My order of chips and salsa were fresh and delicious!

Pe5ghmMJ_gik63wpQ4wMZg.text: Best place to hangout for people living in park view!! It has this good vibe were you can hangout with your friends and have great food!! I will definitely recommend this place

CNKRTYh8e4tefQRiNo6bGg.text: Awesome place right outside my place. Love the set up and beers. Pricey but happy hour is dope!

z4ONqJhtAJeD2Tgmm6ts5A.text: First off, I love the concept of multiple restaurants with limited menus all under the same roof with communal seating.  Reminds me of Time Out in Lisbon, Portugal.  The space is nice on the inside with decent layout.  Its great to have the outdoor space, but that could use some investment to really make it a nice area beyond just some tables with umbrellas.    Food was ok.  Had the Pork Belly BLT with fries cooked in duck fat from Supper.  It was good, but nothing I would crave or immediately say "I will be back for that again".  Price points seem to be on the mark for the value in my opinion, so that is good.  Decent beer selection, though midway through Happy Hour they had already removed four or five selections from the board because they were kicked (luckily not the two selections I had been enjoying).  The line to get drinks was fairly substantial and took at least 10 mins to get a beer, so more staffing during busy times is a must.  Would go back if others wanted to go and would try other food concepts.  As I said, I love the core concept of Federal Gallery but some fairly minor operational and style tweaks would go a long way.

QOAKnbuZkHIjV6Jxb6M0KQ.text: This was my first time eating at a setup like this and I loved the concept. There were good food choices, and a bar to get drinks. The food was yum.. although we ordered way too many fries. We tried the burger at provision. The burger was cooked exactly the way I asked for and it was delicious. Their fries were perfect. We also tried the poutine at supper which was great, it had a brisket gravy with little chunks of beef in it which made it pretty much a meal! We also tried the falafel at supper which i enjoyed but my husband thought was a little bland. The only disappointment for me was the dessert at supper. We got the warm persimmon pudding, which tasted more like warmed up baby food. It did not look appetizing and tasted sort of what it looked like. One of our friends got the grilled cheese at supper and thought it was ok. She said she has had better, she did however love the chickpea fries it came with. We would definitely go back - and definitely order fewer fries next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Federal Galley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uKTDqITTMd9ZwWbTppkLDg.text: Ooooooo y'all I couldn't be happier that the brilliant minds behind Smallman Galley brought their delightful concept into this beautifully renovated space on the Northside.  I am all about this "fancy cafeteria": same delicious lentil fries from Provision that I loved at Smallman so much, yummy tacos from El Lugar, that crispy delicious hot honey and pepperoni pizza from Michigan & Trumbull, and any of the veg-centric dishes from Supper all make it a stand out option for a wide range of palates.    The bar is located in the old bank vault and has a ton of draft options.  Shout out to the boss ass bar staff, which is always super friendly and helpful even when the place is slammed!  They do great happy hour specials, and I can tell a lot of other folks from the neighborhood or who work near by are taking advantage of the spacious, airy atmosphere with communal tables.  I can't wait for the outside space to open this summer!

_TUKnY2Tx3McX-ZpVJVwDw.text: This review is specifically for Lugar, but I don't have some choice words for Supper. I am going to be realistic and say maybe trying a couple of things from each menu isn't a great way to fully judge a place, however these items were so disappointing that I'm going to go ahead and do it.    Lugar- I had the Pork Pibil taco and if you love the taste of dry, day old pork this is the taco for you. For $3.50 you get a $2 Size taco with bland, day old pork that clearly is just reheated in a pan real quick. A place that specializes in tacos should at least do that well.   Supper- I had the Poutine which is really hard to mess up. It's brown pan gravy doused fries with fresh cheese curds. Yet, somehow it was. A pot roast mix was poured over fries and what seemed to be sliced mozzarella sticks. Maybe I am being picky but I had a few drinks and this still didn't satisfy my Poutine graving, I mean craving.   Atmosphere is what you're paying for here, if you miss your school cafeteria you'll be feeling nostalgic all night.

vTSLGuoCypdm85Ut0oX35Q.text: This is a very cool idea for an eatery. There are multiple places with different cuisines, so everyone has the opportunity to eat what they like. It was quite busy when we went, though I was told it is always that way. Luckily, we were able to find seats without much issue.   I ordered a taco plate with veggie and stewed potato tacos. Both was pretty good. I shared the beans and salad with my brother who also go the taco plate. The salad was a little salty. The beans were standard. Everyone else also seemed to enjoy their meals.   I suggest trying the bloody mary if you like them. This one was the perfect amount of horseradish with not a huge amount of tomato juice. Quite delicious.   I love that they provide water to everyone. Every time a water jug was emptied, another would appear at the table. It was like magic. The people who work at Federal Galley are so attentive and fabulous at their jobs.

P0IGBNZYRAe6aHOC4dakXQ.text: This place is like an upscale food court. Basically you come in and choose what bender you would like to eat from seed yourself they would bring the food to you and then you can leave your place there and they will clean up. The food that I am a colleague ate was amazing.  The ambience is so beautiful. The Mamosa was seven dollars.

1qnjELBQjmq4HHld3zofjw.text: This place left me feeling jazzed--in the best way possible.  Supper: Of the four spaces, this was the most intriguing for vegetarian/vegan fare. I had the falafel and pita with chickpea fries; they did not disappoint! The falafel was perfectly crispy and dusted with za'atar which came with an AMAZING honey and harissa dippy sauce.   Provision PGH: My husband got the pork chop and, judging by how quickly it was gone, it must've been delectable. He also ordered the bread and butter which was delightfully toasted on the outside, soft and perfectly airy on the inside--witchcraft!   While I only tried two of the restaurants, I think it might be safe to say the others are pretty dang delicious.

44QPVWsuaF792Zh8A-ExiQ.text: It's a very cool concept, different test restaurants that are there on a limited basis to try out their ideas for restaurants. It's communal eating which is kind of nice for meeting people engaging in conversation. It's a great place if you want a new and different food experience.

OFudTev4EWP1g_8sg2KRIQ.text: It's like the food court from ur local mall in the 80's, only not depressing and less Aqua net hairspray.  My daughter had the grilled cheese and fries from Provisions, it was okay. The fries tasted like the oil might be old and the grilled cheese was alittle over done.   I had the flank steak from Supper, and the chocolate cake for desert (my daughter ate most of it). VERY GOOD !!
